translations.literal: Zhao Gong served as protector, Zhou Gong as teacher. They attacked east to the Huai Yi, destroyed Yan, and moved their ruler to Bo Beng.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao served as protector, the Duke of Zhou as teacher. They attacked east to the Huai Yi, destroyed Yan, and moved their ruler to Bo Beng.

sentences.zh: 成王自奄歸，在宗周，作多方。

translations.literal: King Cheng returned from Yan and, at Zong Zhou, made the Many Regions.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng returned from Yan and, at Zong Zhou, made the Many Regions.

sentences.zh: 既絀殷命，襲淮夷，歸在豐，作周官。

translations.literal: Having ended Yin's mandate and attacked the Huai Yi, he returned at Feng and made the Zhou Officials.
translations.idiomatic: Having ended the Shang's mandate and attacked the Huai Yi, he returned at Feng and made the Zhou Officials.

sentences.zh: 興正禮樂，度制於是改，而民和睦，頌聲興。

translations.literal: He raised correct rites and music, and the measures and systems were thus changed. The people were harmonious, and songs of praise arose.
translations.idiomatic: He raised correct rites and music, and the measures and systems were thus changed. The people were harmonious, and songs of praise arose.

sentences.zh: 成王既伐東夷，息慎來賀，王賜榮伯作賄息慎之命。

translations.literal: King Cheng had already attacked the eastern Yi. Xishen came to congratulate. The king granted Rong Bo to make the command for bribing Xishen.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng had already attacked the eastern Yi. Xishen came to congratulate. The king granted Rong Bo to make the command for bribing Xishen.

translations.literal: King Cheng was at Feng. He had Zhao Gong again build Luoyi, as King Wu had intended. Zhou Gong again divined and extended his view. Finally they built and constructed, placing the nine tripods there. He said: 'This is the center of the realm. The four directions enter with tribute, and the road distances are equal.' He made the Zhao Announcement and Luo Announcement. King Cheng had already moved Yin's remaining people. Zhou Gong, with the king's command, told them and made the Many Officers and No Leisure. Zhao Gong served as protector, Zhou Gong as teacher. They attacked east to the Huai Yi, destroyed Yan, and moved their ruler to Bo Beng. King Cheng returned from Yan and, at Zong Zhou, made the Many Regions. Having ended Yin's mandate and attacked the Huai Yi, he returned at Feng and made the Zhou Officials. He raised correct rites and music, and the measures and systems were thus changed. The people were harmonious, and songs of praise arose. King Cheng had already attacked the eastern Yi. Xishen came to congratulate. The king granted Rong Bo to make the command for bribing Xishen.

sentences.zh: 成王將崩，懼太子釗之不任，乃命召公、畢公率諸侯以相太子而立之。

translations.literal: King Cheng was about to collapse. He feared that Crown Prince Zhao was not capable, so he commanded Zhao Gong and Bi Gong to lead the feudal lords to assist the crown prince and establish him.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng was about to collapse. He feared that Crown Prince Zhao was not capable, so he commanded Duke Zhao and Bi Gong to lead the feudal lords to assist the crown prince and establish him.

sentences.zh: 成王既崩，二公率諸侯，以太子釗見於先王廟，申告以文王、武王之所以為王業之不易，務在節儉，毋多欲，以篤信臨之，作顧命。

translations.literal: King Cheng had already collapsed. The two nobles led the feudal lords and, with Crown Prince Zhao, appeared at the ancestral kings' temple. They repeatedly explained the reasons why Wen Wang and Wu Wang's kingly undertakings were not easy: devotion to frugality, no many desires, and overseeing them with sincere trust. They made the Testament Command.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng had already collapsed. The two nobles led the feudal lords and, with Crown Prince Zhao, appeared at the ancestral kings' temple. They repeatedly explained the reasons why Wen Wang and Wu Wang's kingly undertakings were not easy: devotion to frugality, no many desires, and overseeing them with sincere trust. They made the Testament Command.

sentences.zh: 太子釗遂立，是為康王。

translations.literal: Crown Prince Zhao was then established, and he was called King Kang.
translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Zhao was then established, and he was called King Kang.

sentences.zh: 康王即位，遍告諸侯，宣告以文武之業以申之，作《康誥》。

translations.literal: King Kang ascended the throne and comprehensively told the feudal lords. He declared the undertaking of Wen and Wu to repeat it and made the Kang Announcement.
translations.idiomatic: King Kang ascended the throne and comprehensively told the feudal lords. He declared the undertaking of Wen and Wu to repeat it and made the Kang Announcement.

sentences.zh: 故成康之際，天下安寧，刑錯四十餘年不用。

translations.literal: Therefore, between Cheng and Kang, the realm was peaceful. Punishments were set aside and not used for more than forty years.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, between Cheng and Kang, the realm was peaceful. Punishments were set aside and not used for more than forty years.

sentences.zh: 康王命作策畢公分居里，成周郊，作《畢命》。

translations.literal: King Kang commanded the making of a document for Bi Gong to divide and dwell in the li, in the suburbs of Chengzhou. He made the Bi Command.
translations.idiomatic: King Kang commanded the making of a document for Bi Gong to divide and dwell in the li, in the suburbs of Chengzhou. He made the Bi Command.

translations.literal: King Cheng was about to collapse. He feared that Crown Prince Zhao was not capable, so he commanded Zhao Gong and Bi Gong to lead the feudal lords to assist the crown prince and establish him. King Cheng had already collapsed. The two nobles led the feudal lords and, with Crown Prince Zhao, appeared at the ancestral kings' temple. They repeatedly explained the reasons why Wen Wang and Wu Wang's kingly undertakings were not easy: devotion to frugality, no many desires, and overseeing them with sincere trust. They made the Testament Command. Crown Prince Zhao was then established, and he was called King Kang. King Kang ascended the throne and comprehensively told the feudal lords. He declared the undertaking of Wen and Wu to repeat it and made the Kang Announcement. Therefore, between Cheng and Kang, the realm was peaceful. Punishments were set aside and not used for more than forty years. King Kang commanded the making of a document for Bi Gong to divide and dwell in the li, in the suburbs of Chengzhou. He made the Bi Command.

sentences.zh: 康王卒，子昭王瑕立。

translations.literal: King Kang died, and his son Zhao Wang Xia was established.
translations.idiomatic: King Kang died, and his son Zhao Wang Xia was established.

sentences.zh: 昭王之時，王道微缺。

translations.literal: In Zhao Wang's time, the kingly way was slightly deficient.
translations.idiomatic: In Zhao Wang's time, the kingly way was slightly deficient.

sentences.zh: 昭王南巡狩不返，卒於江上。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang toured south and hunted but did not return. He died above the Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Wang toured south and hunted but did not return. He died above the Jiang.

sentences.zh: 其卒不赴告，諱之也。

translations.literal: His death was not urgently announced; it was tabooed.
translations.idiomatic: His death was not urgently announced; it was tabooed.

sentences.zh: 立昭王子滿，是為穆王。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang's son Man was established, and he was called King Mu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Wang's son Man was established, and he was called King Mu.

sentences.zh: 穆王即位，春秋已五十矣。

translations.literal: King Mu ascended the throne when he was already fifty years old.
translations.idiomatic: King Mu ascended the throne when he was already fifty years old.

sentences.zh: 王道衰微，穆王閔文武之道缺，乃命伯臩申誡太仆國之政，作臩命。

translations.literal: The kingly way declined and weakened. King Mu grieved that Wen and Wu's way was deficient, so he commanded Bo Quan to declare and warn the Grand Coach about state politics. He made the Quan Command.
translations.idiomatic: The kingly way declined and weakened. King Mu grieved that Wen and Wu's way was deficient, so he commanded Bo Quan to declare and warn the Grand Coach about state politics. He made the Quan Command.

sentences.zh: 復寧。

translations.literal: It became peaceful again.
translations.idiomatic: It became peaceful again.

translations.literal: King Kang died, and his son Zhao Wang Xia was established. In Zhao Wang's time, the kingly way was slightly deficient. Zhao Wang toured south and hunted but did not return. He died above the Jiang. His death was not urgently announced; it was tabooed. Zhao Wang's son Man was established, and he was called King Mu. King Mu ascended the throne when he was already fifty years old. The kingly way declined and weakened. King Mu grieved that Wen and Wu's way was deficient, so he commanded Bo Quan to declare and warn the Grand Coach about state politics. He made the Quan Command. It became peaceful again.

sentences.zh: 穆王將征犬戎，祭公謀父諫曰：「不可。

translations.literal: Mu Wang about to campaign Quan Rong, Ji Gong Mou Fu advised: 'Not possible.
translations.idiomatic: King Mu was about to campaign against the Quanrong. Ji Gong Moufu advised: 'It is not possible.

sentences.zh: 先王燿德不觀兵。

translations.literal: The former kings shone with virtue and did not inspect troops.
translations.idiomatic: The former kings shone with virtue and did not inspect troops.

sentences.zh: 夫兵戢而時動，動則威，觀則玩，玩則無震。

translations.literal: Indeed, troops are stored and only move at the right time. When they move, they inspire awe. When inspected, they become frivolous. When frivolous, they inspire no fear.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, troops are stored and only move at the right time. When they move, they inspire awe. When inspected, they become frivolous. When frivolous, they inspire no fear.

sentences.zh: 是故周文公之頌曰：『載戢干戈，載櫜弓矢，我求懿德，肆于時夏，允王保之。』

translations.literal: This reason Zhou Wen Gong ode says: 'Loaded stored weapons, loaded sheathed bows arrows, I seek excellent virtue, extend to timely Xia, truly king protects it.'
translations.idiomatic: This is why the ode of Zhou Wen Gong says: 'Loaded and stored the weapons, loaded and sheathed the bows and arrows. I seek excellent virtue, extending it to timely Xia. Truly the king protects it.'

sentences.zh: 先王之於民也，茂正其德而厚其性，阜其財求而利其器用，明利害之鄉，以文修之，使之務利而辟害，懷德而畏威，故能保世以滋大。

translations.literal: The former kings toward the people: luxuriantly corrected their virtue and thickened their nature, enriched their wealth-seeking and benefited their utensil use, clarified the directions of benefit and harm, and repaired them with culture. They made them devote themselves to benefit and avoid harm, cherish virtue and fear awe. Therefore they could preserve generations and increase greatly.
translations.idiomatic: The former kings toward the people: luxuriantly corrected their virtue and thickened their nature, enriched their wealth-seeking and benefited their utensil use, clarified the directions of benefit and harm, and repaired them with culture. They made them devote themselves to benefit and avoid harm, cherish virtue and fear awe. Therefore they could preserve generations and increase greatly.

sentences.zh: 昔我先王世后稷以服事虞、夏。

translations.literal: Formerly my former kings, generation after generation, served Yu and Xia as Hou Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Formerly my former kings, generation after generation, served Yu and Xia as Hou Ji.

sentences.zh: 及夏之衰也，棄稷不務，我先王不窋用失其官，而自竄於戎狄之閒。

translations.literal: When Xia declined, they abandoned Ji and were not diligent. My former king Bu Xu lost his office because of this, and then fled himself among the Rong and Di.
translations.idiomatic: When Xia declined, they abandoned Ji and were not diligent. My former king Bu Xu lost his office because of this, and then fled himself among the Rong and Di.

sentences.zh: 不敢怠業，時序其德，遵修其緒，修其訓典，朝夕恪勤，守以敦篤，奉以忠信。

translations.literal: They dared not be lax in their undertakings, timely arranged their virtue, followed and repaired their continuation, repaired their instruction canons, and were respectfully diligent morning and evening. They guarded with sincere solidity and served with loyal trust.
translations.idiomatic: They dared not be lax in their undertakings, timely arranged their virtue, followed and repaired their continuation, repaired their instruction canons, and were respectfully diligent morning and evening. They guarded with sincere solidity and served with loyal trust.

sentences.zh: 奕世載德，不忝前人。

translations.literal: Many generations carried virtue and did not disgrace their predecessors.
translations.idiomatic: Many generations carried virtue and did not disgrace their predecessors.

sentences.zh: 至于文王、武王，昭前之光明而加之以慈和，事神保民，無不欣喜。

translations.literal: When it arrived at Wen Wang and Wu Wang, they illuminated the former brightness and added kind harmony. They served the spirits and protected the people. Nothing was not joyful.
translations.idiomatic: When it arrived at Wen Wang and Wu Wang, they illuminated the former brightness and added kind harmony. They served the spirits and protected the people. Nothing was not joyful.

sentences.zh: 商王帝辛大惡于民，庶民不忍，訢載武王，以致戎于商牧。

translations.literal: Shang king Di Xin was greatly evil toward the people. The common people could not bear it, united and carried Wu Wang, to bring weapons to the Shang pasture.
translations.idiomatic: Shang king Di Xin was greatly evil toward the people. The common people could not bear it, united and carried Wu Wang, to bring weapons to the Shang pasture.

sentences.zh: 是故先王非務武也，勸恤民隱而除其害也。

translations.literal: This is why the former kings were not devoted to martial matters. They urged relief of the people's hidden sufferings and removed their harms.
translations.idiomatic: This is why the former kings were not devoted to martial matters. They urged relief of the people's hidden sufferings and removed their harms.

sentences.zh: 夫先王之制，邦內甸服，邦外侯服，侯衛賓服，夷蠻要服，戎翟荒服。

translations.literal: Indeed, the former kings' system: within the state dian service, outside the state hou service, hou wei bin service, yi man yao service, rong di huang service.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the former kings' system: within the state dian service, outside the state hou service, hou wei bin service, yi man yao service, rong di huang service.

sentences.zh: 甸服者祭，侯服者祀，賓服者享，要服者貢，荒服者王。

translations.literal: Dian service: sacrifice. Hou service: ancestral rites. Bin service: present. Yao service: tribute. Huang service: king.
translations.idiomatic: Dian service: sacrifice. Hou service: ancestral rites. Bin service: present. Yao service: tribute. Huang service: king.

sentences.zh: 日祭，月祀，時享，歲貢，終王。

translations.literal: Day: sacrifice. Month: rites. Season: present. Year: tribute. Finally: king.
translations.idiomatic: Day: sacrifice. Month: rites. Season: present. Year: tribute. Finally: king.

sentences.zh: 先王之順祀也，有不祭則修意，有不祀則修言，有不享則修文，有不貢則修名，有不王則修德，序成而有不至則修刑。

translations.literal: The former kings' orderly sacrifices: if there was no sacrifice, then they repaired their intention. If no rites, repaired their words. If no present, repaired their culture. If no tribute, repaired their name. If no king, repaired their virtue. When the order was complete and there were those who did not arrive, then they repaired with punishment.
translations.idiomatic: The former kings' orderly sacrifices: if there was no sacrifice, then they repaired their intention. If no rites, repaired their words. If no present, repaired their culture. If no tribute, repaired their name. If no king, repaired their virtue. When the order was complete and there were those who did not arrive, then they repaired with punishment.

sentences.zh: 於是有刑不祭，伐不祀，征不享，讓不貢，告不王。

translations.literal: Thus there were punishments for not sacrificing, attacks for not performing rites, campaigns for not presenting, remonstrations for not tributing, and announcements for not kinging.
translations.idiomatic: Thus there were punishments for not sacrificing, attacks for not performing rites, campaigns for not presenting, remonstrations for not tributing, and announcements for not kinging.

sentences.zh: 於是有刑罰之辟，有攻伐之兵，有征討之備，有威讓之命，有文告之辭。

translations.literal: Thus there were laws of punishment, troops for attacking and campaigning, preparations for campaigning and attacking, commands of awe and remonstration, and words of cultural announcements.
translations.idiomatic: Thus there were laws of punishment, troops for attacking and campaigning, preparations for campaigning and attacking, commands of awe and remonstration, and words of cultural announcements.

sentences.zh: 布令陳辭而有不至，則增修於德，無勤民於遠。

translations.literal: When commands were spread and words arranged but there were those who did not arrive, then they increased repair at virtue, without laboring the people from afar.
translations.idiomatic: When commands were spread and words arranged but there were those who did not arrive, then they increased repair at virtue, without laboring the people from afar.

sentences.zh: 是以近無不聽，遠無不服。

translations.literal: This is why nothing near did not listen, nothing far did not submit.
translations.idiomatic: This is why nothing near did not listen, nothing far did not submit.

sentences.zh: 今自大畢、伯士之終也，犬戎氏以其職來王，天子曰『予必以不享征之，且觀之兵』，無乃廢先王之訓，而王幾頓乎？

translations.literal: Now from Da Bi, Bo Shi end, Quan Rong clan with their duty came king, Son of Heaven said 'I must with not present campaign them, moreover observe their troops', no perhaps abandon former kings instruction, and king nearly collapse?
translations.idiomatic: Now, since the end of Da Bi and Bo Shi, the Quanrong clan came with their duty to king. The Son of Heaven said: 'I must campaign against them for not presenting, and moreover observe their troops.' Is this not abandoning the former kings' instruction, and will the king nearly collapse?

sentences.zh: 吾聞犬戎樹敦，率舊德而守終純固，其有以御我矣。」

translations.literal: I heard Quan Rong establish solid, follow old virtue and guard end pure firm, they have to defend me.'
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that the Quanrong establish solidity, follow old virtue and guard the end purely and firmly. They have means to defend against me.'

sentences.zh: 王遂征之，得四白狼四白鹿以歸。

translations.literal: The king then campaigned against them and got four white wolves and four white deer to return with.
translations.idiomatic: The king then campaigned against them and got four white wolves and four white deer to return with.

sentences.zh: 自是荒服者不至。

translations.literal: From this time, the huang service did not arrive.
translations.idiomatic: From this time, the huang service did not arrive.

translations.literal: King Mu was about to campaign against the Quanrong. Ji Gong Moufu advised: 'It is not possible. The former kings shone with virtue and did not inspect troops. Indeed, troops are stored and only move at the right time. When they move, they inspire awe. When inspected, they become frivolous. When frivolous, they inspire no fear. This is why the ode of Zhou Wen Gong says: 'Loaded and stored the weapons, loaded and sheathed the bows and arrows. I seek excellent virtue, extending it to timely Xia. Truly the king protects it.' The former kings toward the people: luxuriantly corrected their virtue and thickened their nature, enriched their wealth-seeking and benefited their utensil use, clarified the directions of benefit and harm, and repaired them with culture. They made them devote themselves to benefit and avoid harm, cherish virtue and fear awe. Therefore they could preserve generations and increase greatly. Formerly my former kings, generation after generation, served Yu and Xia as Hou Ji. When Xia declined, they abandoned Ji and were not diligent. My former king Bu Xu lost his office because of this, and then fled himself among the Rong and Di. They dared not be lax in their undertakings, timely arranged their virtue, followed and repaired their continuation, repaired their instruction canons, and were respectfully diligent morning and evening. They guarded with sincere solidity and served with loyal trust. Many generations carried virtue and did not disgrace their predecessors. When it arrived at Wen Wang and Wu Wang, they illuminated the former brightness and added kind harmony. They served the spirits and protected the people. Nothing was not joyful. Shang king Di Xin was greatly evil toward the people. The common people could not bear it, united and carried Wu Wang, to bring weapons to the Shang pasture. This is why the former kings were not devoted to martial matters. They urged relief of the people's hidden sufferings and removed their harms. Indeed, the former kings' system: within the state dian service, outside the state hou service, hou wei bin service, yi man yao service, rong di huang service. Dian service: sacrifice. Hou service: ancestral rites. Bin service: present. Yao service: tribute. Huang service: king. Day: sacrifice. Month: rites. Season: present. Year: tribute. Finally: king. The former kings' orderly sacrifices: if there was no sacrifice, then they repaired their intention. If no rites, repaired their words. If no present, repaired their culture. If no tribute, repaired their name. If no king, repaired their virtue. When the order was complete and there were those who did not arrive, then they repaired with punishment. Thus there were punishments for not sacrificing, attacks for not performing rites, campaigns for not presenting, remonstrations for not tributing, and announcements for not kinging. Thus there were laws of punishment, troops for attacking and campaigning, preparations for campaigning and attacking, commands of awe and remonstration, and words of cultural announcements. When commands were spread and words arranged but there were those who did not arrive, then they increased repair at virtue, without laboring the people from afar. This is why nothing near did not listen, nothing far did not submit. Now, since the end of Da Bi and Bo Shi, the Quanrong clan came with their duty to king. The Son of Heaven said: 'I must campaign against them for not presenting, and moreover observe their troops.' Is this not abandoning the former kings' instruction, and will the king nearly collapse? I have heard that the Quanrong establish solidity, follow old virtue and guard the end purely and firmly. They have means to defend against me.' The king then campaigned against them and got four white wolves and four white deer to return with. From this time, the huang service did not arrive.

sentences.zh: 諸侯有不睦者，甫侯言於王，作修刑辟。

translations.literal: When feudal lords were not harmonious, Fu Hou spoke to the king and made the repair punishment laws.
translations.idiomatic: When feudal lords were not harmonious, Fu Hou spoke to the king and made the repair punishment laws.

sentences.zh: 王曰：「吁，來！

translations.literal: King said: 'Ah, come!
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Ah, come!

sentences.zh: 有國有土，告汝祥刑。

translations.literal: You have states and lands. I tell you of auspicious punishments.
translations.idiomatic: You have states and lands. I tell you of auspicious punishments.

sentences.zh: 在今爾安百姓，何擇非其人，何敬非其刑，何居非其宜與？

translations.literal: In now you pacify common people, what choose not their people, what respect not their punishments, what dwell not their suitable?
translations.idiomatic: Now you pacify the common people. What do you choose that is not the right people? What do you respect that is not the right punishments? What do you dwell in that is not suitable?

sentences.zh: 兩造具備，師聽五辭。

translations.literal: Both sides are fully prepared. The master hears the five arguments.
translations.idiomatic: Both sides are fully prepared. The master hears the five arguments.

sentences.zh: 五辭簡信，正於五刑。

translations.literal: The five arguments are simple and trustworthy, corrected by the five punishments.
translations.idiomatic: The five arguments are simple and trustworthy, corrected by the five punishments.

sentences.zh: 五刑不簡，正於五罰。

translations.literal: The five punishments are not simple, corrected by the five penalties.
translations.idiomatic: The five punishments are not simple, corrected by the five penalties.

sentences.zh: 五罰不服，正於五過。

translations.literal: The five penalties do not submit, corrected by the five faults.
translations.idiomatic: The five penalties do not submit, corrected by the five faults.

sentences.zh: 五過之疵，官獄內獄，閱實其罪，惟鈞其過。

translations.literal: The blemish of the five faults: official prison, inner prison. Examine the reality of their crimes, only balance their faults.
translations.idiomatic: The blemish of the five faults: official prison, inner prison. Examine the reality of their crimes, only balance their faults.

sentences.zh: 五刑之疑有赦，五罰之疑有赦，其審克之。

translations.literal: For doubts in the five punishments there is pardon, for doubts in the five penalties there is pardon. Examine and overcome them.
translations.idiomatic: For doubts in the five punishments there is pardon, for doubts in the five penalties there is pardon. Examine and overcome them.

sentences.zh: 簡信有眾，惟訊有稽。

translations.literal: Simple and trustworthy have the multitude. Only interrogation has records.
translations.idiomatic: Simple and trustworthy have the multitude. Only interrogation has records.

sentences.zh: 無簡不疑，共嚴天威。

translations.literal: Nothing simple is not doubted. Together stern with Heaven's majesty.
translations.idiomatic: Nothing simple is not doubted. Together stern with Heaven's majesty.

sentences.zh: 黥辟疑赦，其罰百率，閱實其罪。

translations.literal: For tattoo law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is one hundred rates. Examine the reality of their crimes.
translations.idiomatic: For tattoo law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is one hundred rates. Examine the reality of their crimes.

sentences.zh: 劓辟疑赦，其罰倍灑，閱實其罪。

translations.literal: For nose-cutting law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is double the drink. Examine the reality of their crimes.
translations.idiomatic: For nose-cutting law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is double the drink. Examine the reality of their crimes.

sentences.zh: 臏辟疑赦，其罰倍差，閱實其罪。

translations.literal: For shin-cutting law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is double the difference. Examine the reality of their crimes.
translations.idiomatic: For shin-cutting law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is double the difference. Examine the reality of their crimes.

sentences.zh: 宮辟疑赦，其罰五百率，閱實其罪。

translations.literal: For castration law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is five hundred rates. Examine the reality of their crimes.
translations.idiomatic: For castration law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is five hundred rates. Examine the reality of their crimes.

sentences.zh: 大辟疑赦，其罰千率，閱實其罪。

translations.literal: For great execution law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is one thousand rates. Examine the reality of their crimes.
translations.idiomatic: For great execution law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is one thousand rates. Examine the reality of their crimes.

sentences.zh: 墨罰之屬千，劓罰之屬千，臏罰之屬五百，宮罰之屬三百，大辟之罰其屬二百：五刑之屬三千。」

translations.literal: Tattoo penalty belonging thousand, nose cut penalty belonging thousand, shin cut penalty belonging five hundred, castration penalty belonging three hundred, great execution penalty its belonging two hundred: five punishments belonging three thousand.'
translations.idiomatic: Tattoo penalties belong to one thousand, nose-cutting penalties belong to one thousand, shin-cutting penalties belong to five hundred, castration penalties belong to three hundred, great execution penalties belong to two hundred: the five punishments belong to three thousand.'

sentences.zh: 命曰甫刑。

translations.literal: It was commanded to be called the Fu Punishment.
translations.idiomatic: It was commanded to be called the Fu Punishment.

translations.literal: When feudal lords were not harmonious, Fu Hou spoke to the king and made the repair punishment laws. The king said: 'Ah, come! You have states and lands. I tell you of auspicious punishments. Now you pacify the common people. What do you choose that is not the right people? What do you respect that is not the right punishments? What do you dwell in that is not suitable? Both sides are fully prepared. The master hears the five arguments. The five arguments are simple and trustworthy, corrected by the five punishments. The five punishments are not simple, corrected by the five penalties. The five penalties do not submit, corrected by the five faults. The blemish of the five faults: official prison, inner prison. Examine the reality of their crimes, only balance their faults. For doubts in the five punishments there is pardon, for doubts in the five penalties there is pardon. Examine and overcome them. Simple and trustworthy have the multitude. Only interrogation has records. Nothing simple is not doubted. Together stern with Heaven's majesty. For tattoo law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is one hundred rates. Examine the reality of their crimes. For nose-cutting law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is double the drink. Examine the reality of their crimes. For shin-cutting law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is double the difference. Examine the reality of their crimes. For castration law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is five hundred rates. Examine the reality of their crimes. For great execution law doubts there is pardon. Its penalty is one thousand rates. Examine the reality of their crimes. Tattoo penalties belong to one thousand, nose-cutting penalties belong to one thousand, shin-cutting penalties belong to five hundred, castration penalties belong to three hundred, great execution penalties belong to two hundred: the five punishments belong to three thousand.' It was commanded to be called the Fu Punishment.

sentences.zh: 穆王立五十五年，崩，子共王繄扈立。

translations.literal: King Mu was established for fifty-five years. He collapsed, and his son King Gong Yi Hu was established.
translations.idiomatic: King Mu ascended the throne for fifty-five years. He passed away, and his son King Gong Yi Hu ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 共王游於涇上，密康公從，有三女奔之。

translations.literal: King Gong toured above the Jing. Mi Kang Gong followed. Three women fled to him.
translations.idiomatic: King Gong toured above the Jing. Mi Kang Gong followed. Three women fled to him.

sentences.zh: 其母曰：「必致之王。

translations.literal: Their mother said: 'Must present them to king.
translations.idiomatic: Their mother said: 'You must present them to the king.

sentences.zh: 夫獸三為群，人三為眾，女三為粲。

translations.literal: Indeed, three beasts make a herd, three people make a multitude, three women make resplendence.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, three beasts make a herd, three people make a multitude, three women make resplendence.

sentences.zh: 王田不取群，公行不下眾，王御不參一族。

translations.literal: The king on a hunt does not take a herd. The duke on a journey does not go below a multitude. The king in taking does not mix with one clan.
translations.idiomatic: The king on a hunt does not take a herd. The lord on a journey does not go below a multitude. The king in taking does not mix with one clan.

sentences.zh: 夫粲，美之物也。

translations.literal: Indeed, resplendence is a thing of beauty.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, resplendence is a thing of beauty.

sentences.zh: 眾以美物歸女，而何德以堪之？

translations.literal: Multitude with beautiful things return you, and what virtue to bear it?
translations.idiomatic: The multitude returns beautiful things to you. What virtue do you have to bear it?

sentences.zh: 王猶不堪，況爾之小醜乎！

translations.literal: King still cannot bear, moreover your small ugliness!
translations.idiomatic: Even the king cannot bear it. How much more your small ugliness!

sentences.zh: 小醜備物，終必亡。」

translations.literal: Small ugliness prepared things, finally must perish.'
translations.idiomatic: Small ugliness prepares things. In the end it must perish.'

sentences.zh: 康公不獻，一年，共王滅密。

translations.literal: Kang Gong did not offer them. After one year, King Gong extinguished Mi.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Gong did not offer them. After one year, King Gong extinguished Mi.

sentences.zh: 共王崩，子懿王艱立。

translations.literal: King Gong collapsed, and his son King Yi Jian was established.
translations.idiomatic: King Gong passed away, and his son King Yi Jian ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 懿王之時，王室遂衰，詩人作刺。

translations.literal: In King Yi's time, the royal house then declined. Poets made satires.
translations.idiomatic: In King Yi's time, the royal house then declined. Poets made satires.

translations.literal: King Mu was established for fifty-five years. He collapsed, and his son King Gong Yi Hu was established. King Gong toured above the Jing. Mi Kang Gong followed. Three women fled to him. Their mother said: 'You must present them to the king. Indeed, three beasts make a herd, three people make a multitude, three women make resplendence. The king on a hunt does not take a herd. The duke on a journey does not go below a multitude. The king in taking does not mix with one clan. Indeed, resplendence is a thing of beauty. The multitude returns beautiful things to you. What virtue do you have to bear it? Even the king cannot bear it. How much more your small ugliness! Small ugliness prepares things. In the end it must perish.' Kang Gong did not offer them. After one year, King Gong extinguished Mi. King Gong collapsed, and his son King Yi Jian was established. In King Yi's time, the royal house then declined. Poets made satires.

sentences.zh: 懿王崩，共王弟辟方立，是為孝王。

translations.literal: King Yi collapsed. King Gong's younger brother Bi Fang was established, and he was called King Xiao.
translations.idiomatic: King Yi passed away. King Gong's younger brother Bi Fang ascended the throne, and he was called King Xiao.

sentences.zh: 孝王崩，諸侯復立懿王太子燮，是為夷王。

translations.literal: King Xiao collapsed. The feudal lords again established King Yi's crown prince Xie, and he was called King Yi.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiao passed away. The feudal lords again enthroned King Yi's crown prince Xie, and he was called King Yi.

translations.literal: King Yi collapsed. King Gong's younger brother Bi Fang was established, and he was called King Xiao. King Xiao collapsed. The feudal lords again established King Yi's crown prince Xie, and he was called King Yi.

sentences.zh: 夷王崩，子厲王胡立。

translations.literal: King Yi collapsed, and his son King Li Hu was established.
translations.idiomatic: King Yi passed away, and his son King Li Hu ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 厲王即位三十年，好利，近榮夷公。

translations.literal: King Li ascended the throne for thirty years. He liked profit and approached Rong Yi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: King Li ascended the throne for thirty years. He liked profit and approached Rong Yi Gong.

sentences.zh: 大夫芮良夫諫厲王曰：「王室其將卑乎？

translations.literal: Grandee Rui Liang Fu advised Li Wang: 'Royal house perhaps will be low?
translations.idiomatic: The grandee Rui Liangfu advised King Li: 'Will the royal house perhaps be brought low?

sentences.zh: 夫榮公好專利而不知大難。

translations.literal: Indeed, Rong Gong likes to monopolize profit and does not know great difficulties.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, Rong Gong likes to monopolize profit and does not know great difficulties.

sentences.zh: 夫利，百物之所生也，天地之所載也，而有專之，其害多矣。

translations.literal: Indeed, profit is what the hundred things are born from, what heaven and earth carry. If someone monopolizes it, the harm is great.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, profit is what the hundred things are born from, what heaven and earth carry. If someone monopolizes it, the harm is great.

sentences.zh: 天地百物皆將取焉，何可專也？

translations.literal: Heaven earth hundred things all will take therefrom, what can monopolize?
translations.idiomatic: Heaven and earth's hundred things will all take from it. How can it be monopolized?

sentences.zh: 所怒甚多，不備大難。

translations.literal: What has angered many people. Not prepared for great difficulties.
translations.idiomatic: What has angered many people. Not prepared for great difficulties.

sentences.zh: 以是教王，王其能久乎？

translations.literal: With this teach king, king perhaps can long?
translations.idiomatic: With this teaching the king, will the king perhaps last long?

sentences.zh: 夫王人者，將導利而布之上下者也。

translations.literal: Indeed, ruling people means guiding profit and distributing it to superiors and inferiors.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, ruling people means guiding profit and distributing it to superiors and inferiors.

sentences.zh: 使神人百物無不得極，猶日怵惕懼怨之來也。

translations.literal: Making spirits, people, and the hundred things all achieve their utmost, yet still daily alarmed and fearing resentment's coming.
translations.idiomatic: Making spirits, people, and the hundred things all achieve their utmost, yet still daily alarmed and fearing resentment's coming.

sentences.zh: 故《頌》曰『思文后稷，克配彼天，立我蒸民，莫匪爾極』。

translations.literal: Therefore Ode says 'Think cultured Hou Ji, able match that heaven, establish our numerous people, nothing not your extreme.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the Ode says: 'Think of cultured Hou Ji, who was able to match that heaven, established our numerous people, nothing was not your utmost.'

sentences.zh: 大雅曰『陳錫載周』。

translations.literal: Great Elegant says 'Display bestow carry Zhou.'
translations.idiomatic: The Great Elegant says: 'Display and bestow, carrying Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 是不布利而懼難乎，故能載周以至于今。

translations.literal: This did not distribute profit and feared difficulties, therefore could carry Zhou until now.
translations.idiomatic: This did not distribute profit and feared difficulties, therefore could carry Zhou until now.

sentences.zh: 今王學專利，其可乎？

translations.literal: Now king learn monopolize profit, its possible?
translations.idiomatic: Now the king learns to monopolize profit. Is this possible?

sentences.zh: 匹夫專利，猶謂之盜，王而行之，其歸鮮矣。

translations.literal: A common man monopolizing profit is still called a thief. If the king does it, his following will be few.
translations.idiomatic: A common man monopolizing profit is still called a thief. If the king does it, his following will be few.

sentences.zh: 榮公若用，周必敗也。」

translations.literal: Rong Gong if used, Zhou certainly fail.'
translations.idiomatic: If Rong Gong is employed, Zhou will certainly fail.'

sentences.zh: 厲王不聽，卒以榮公為卿士，用事。

translations.literal: King Li did not listen. He finally made Rong Gong the chief minister to handle affairs.
translations.idiomatic: King Li did not listen. He finally made Rong Gong the chief minister to handle affairs.

translations.literal: King Yi collapsed, and his son King Li Hu was established. King Li ascended the throne for thirty years. He liked profit and approached Rong Yi Gong. The grandee Rui Liangfu advised King Li: 'Will the royal house perhaps be brought low? Indeed, Rong Gong likes to monopolize profit and does not know great difficulties. Indeed, profit is what the hundred things are born from, what heaven and earth carry. If someone monopolizes it, the harm is great. Heaven and earth's hundred things will all take from it. How can it be monopolized? What has angered many people. Not prepared for great difficulties. With this teaching the king, will the king perhaps last long? Indeed, ruling people means guiding profit and distributing it to superiors and inferiors. Making spirits, people, and the hundred things all achieve their utmost, yet still daily alarmed and fearing resentment's coming. Therefore the Ode says: 'Think of cultured Hou Ji, who was able to match that heaven, established our numerous people, nothing was not your utmost.' The Great Elegant says: 'Display and bestow, carrying Zhou.' This did not distribute profit and feared difficulties, therefore could carry Zhou until now. Now the king learns to monopolize profit. Is this possible? A common man monopolizing profit is still called a thief. If the king does it, his following will be few. If Rong Gong is employed, Zhou will certainly fail.' King Li did not listen. He finally made Rong Gong the chief minister to handle affairs.

sentences.zh: 王行暴虐侈傲，國人謗王。

translations.literal: The king acted tyrannically, extravagantly, and arrogantly. The people of the state slandered the king.
translations.idiomatic: The king acted tyrannically, extravagantly, and arrogantly. The people of the state slandered the king.

sentences.zh: 召公諫曰：「民不堪命矣。」

translations.literal: Zhao Gong advised: 'People cannot bear commands.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gong advised: 'The people cannot bear the commands anymore.'

sentences.zh: 王怒，得衛巫，使監謗者，以告則殺之。

translations.literal: The king was angry. He got a sorcerer from Wei to monitor slanderers, and when they were reported, he killed them.
translations.idiomatic: The king was angry. He got a sorcerer from Wei to monitor slanderers, and when they were reported, he killed them.

sentences.zh: 其謗鮮矣，諸侯不朝。

translations.literal: Their slander became few. The feudal lords did not come to court.
translations.idiomatic: Their slander became few. The feudal lords did not come to court.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，王益嚴，國人莫敢言，道路以目。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fourth year, the king became increasingly strict. The people of the state dared not speak. On the roads they communicated with their eyes.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, the king became increasingly strict. The people of the state dared not speak. On the roads they communicated with their eyes.

sentences.zh: 厲王喜，告召公曰：「吾能弭謗矣，乃不敢言。」

translations.literal: Li Wang pleased, told Zhao Gong: 'I can stop slander, now dare not speak.'
translations.idiomatic: King Li was pleased and told Zhao Gong: 'I can stop the slander now. They dare not speak.'

sentences.zh: 召公曰：「是鄣之也。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong said: 'This dams it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gong said: 'This dams it.

sentences.zh: 防民之口，甚於防水。

translations.literal: Blocking the people's mouths is worse than blocking water.
translations.idiomatic: Blocking the people's mouths is worse than blocking water.

sentences.zh: 水壅而潰，傷人必多，民亦如之。

translations.literal: When water is dammed it bursts, injuring many people. The people are also like that.
translations.idiomatic: When water is dammed it bursts, injuring many people. The people are also like that.

sentences.zh: 是故為水者決之使導，為民者宣之使言。

translations.literal: This is why for water one opens it to make it flow, for people one proclaims it to make them speak.
translations.idiomatic: This is why for water one opens it to make it flow, for people one proclaims it to make them speak.

sentences.zh: 故天子聽政，使公卿至於列士獻詩，瞽獻曲，史獻書，師箴，瞍賦，矇誦，百工諫，庶人傳語，近臣盡規，親戚補察，瞽史教誨，耆艾修之，而後王斟酌焉，是以事行而不悖。

translations.literal: Therefore the Son of Heaven hears government and makes nobles down to ranked scholars offer poems, the blind offer tunes, historians offer books, masters admonish, the blind assign compositions, the blind recite, the hundred craftsmen remonstrate, common people transmit words, close ministers exhaust their admonitions, relatives supplement their observations, blind historians teach and instruct, elders and aged repair them, and then the king considers them. This is why affairs proceed without contradiction.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the Son of Heaven hears government and makes nobles down to ranked scholars offer poems, the blind offer tunes, historians offer books, masters admonish, the blind assign compositions, the blind recite, the hundred craftsmen remonstrate, common people transmit words, close ministers exhaust their admonitions, relatives supplement their observations, blind historians teach and instruct, elders and aged repair them, and then the king considers them. This is why affairs proceed without contradiction.

sentences.zh: 民之有口也，猶土之有山川也，財用於是乎出：猶其有原隰衍沃也，衣食於是乎生。

translations.literal: People have mouths, like earth has mountains rivers, wealth use from this out: like its have plains marshes level fertile, clothing food from this born.
translations.idiomatic: The people having mouths is like the earth having mountains and rivers—wealth and use come out from this. It is like having plains, marshes, level lands, and fertile areas—clothing and food are born from this.

sentences.zh: 口之宣言也，善敗於是乎興。

translations.literal: Mouths declaring words—good and bad arise from this.
translations.idiomatic: Mouths declaring words—good and bad arise from this.

sentences.zh: 行善而備敗，所以產財用衣食者也。

translations.literal: Practicing good while preparing for bad is what produces wealth, use, clothing, and food.
translations.idiomatic: Practicing good while preparing for bad is what produces wealth, use, clothing, and food.

sentences.zh: 夫民慮之於心而宣之於口，成而行之。

translations.literal: Indeed, the people consider it in their hearts and declare it with their mouths, complete it and do it.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the people consider it in their hearts and declare it with their mouths, complete it and do it.

sentences.zh: 若壅其口，其與能幾何？」

translations.literal: If dam their mouths, its with can how much?'
translations.idiomatic: If their mouths are dammed, how much can it endure?'

sentences.zh: 王不聽。

translations.literal: The king did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: The king did not listen.

sentences.zh: 於是國莫敢出言，三年，乃相與畔，襲厲王。

translations.literal: Thus none in the state dared speak out. After three years, they mutually rebelled and attacked King Li.
translations.idiomatic: Thus none in the state dared speak out. After three years, they mutually rebelled and attacked King Li.

sentences.zh: 厲王出奔於彘。

translations.literal: King Li fled to Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: King Li fled to Zhi.

translations.literal: The king acted tyrannically, extravagantly, and arrogantly. The people of the state slandered the king. Zhao Gong advised: 'The people cannot bear the commands anymore.' The king was angry. He got a sorcerer from Wei to monitor slanderers, and when they were reported, he killed them. Their slander became few. The feudal lords did not come to court. In the thirty-fourth year, the king became increasingly strict. The people of the state dared not speak. On the roads they communicated with their eyes. King Li was pleased and told Zhao Gong: 'I can stop the slander now. They dare not speak.' Zhao Gong said: 'This dams it. Blocking the people's mouths is worse than blocking water. When water is dammed it bursts, injuring many people. The people are also like that. This is why for water one opens it to make it flow, for people one proclaims it to make them speak. Therefore the Son of Heaven hears government and makes nobles down to ranked scholars offer poems, the blind offer tunes, historians offer books, masters admonish, the blind assign compositions, the blind recite, the hundred craftsmen remonstrate, common people transmit words, close ministers exhaust their admonitions, relatives supplement their observations, blind historians teach and instruct, elders and aged repair them, and then the king considers them. This is why affairs proceed without contradiction. The people having mouths is like the earth having mountains and rivers—wealth and use come out from this. It is like having plains, marshes, level lands, and fertile areas—clothing and food are born from this. Mouths declaring words—good and bad arise from this. Practicing good while preparing for bad is what produces wealth, use, clothing, and food. Indeed, the people consider it in their hearts and declare it with their mouths, complete it and do it. If their mouths are dammed, how much can it endure?' The king did not listen. Thus none in the state dared speak out. After three years, they mutually rebelled and attacked King Li. King Li fled to Zhi.

sentences.zh: 厲王太子靜匿召公之家，國人聞之，乃圍之。

translations.literal: King Li's crown prince Jing hid in Zhao Gong's home. The people of the state heard this and surrounded it.
translations.idiomatic: King Li's crown prince Jing hid in Zhao Gong's home. The people of the state heard this and surrounded it.

sentences.zh: 召公曰：「昔吾驟諫王，王不從，以及此難也。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong said: 'Formerly I repeatedly advised king, king not follow, reach this difficulty.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gong said: 'Formerly I repeatedly advised the king. The king did not follow, and we have reached this difficulty.

sentences.zh: 今殺王太子，王其以我為讎而懟怒乎？

translations.literal: Now kill king crown prince, king perhaps consider me enemy and resent angry?
translations.idiomatic: Now if we kill the king's crown prince, will the king consider me an enemy and resentfully be angry?

sentences.zh: 夫事君者，險而不讎懟，怨而不怒，況事王乎！」

translations.literal: Indeed serve ruler, perilous and not enemy resent, resent and not angry, moreover serve king!'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, serving a ruler: perilous but not treating as enemy with resentment, resentful but not angry. How much more serving a king!'

sentences.zh: 乃以其子代王太子，太子竟得脫。

translations.literal: Then he used his own son to substitute for the king's crown prince. The crown prince finally escaped.
translations.idiomatic: Then he used his own son to substitute for the king's crown prince. The crown prince finally escaped.

translations.literal: King Li's crown prince Jing hid in Zhao Gong's home. The people of the state heard this and surrounded it. Zhao Gong said: 'Formerly I repeatedly advised the king. The king did not follow, and we have reached this difficulty. Now if we kill the king's crown prince, will the king consider me an enemy and resentfully be angry? Indeed, serving a ruler: perilous but not treating as enemy with resentment, resentful but not angry. How much more serving a king!' Then he used his own son to substitute for the king's crown prince. The crown prince finally escaped.

sentences.zh: 召公、周公二相行政，號曰「共和」。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong, Zhou Gong two ministers administered government, titled called 'Republican.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gong and Zhou Gong, the two ministers, administered the government. It was titled 'Republican.'

sentences.zh: 共和十四年，厲王死于彘。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year of the Republican period, King Li died at Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year of the Republican period, King Li died at Zhi.

sentences.zh: 太子靜長於召公家，二相乃共立之為王，是為宣王。

translations.literal: Crown prince Jing grew up in Zhao Gong's home. The two ministers then jointly established him as king. He was called King Xuan.
translations.idiomatic: Crown prince Jing grew up in Zhao Gong's home. The two ministers then jointly established him as king. He was called King Xuan.

sentences.zh: 宣王即位，二相輔之，修政，法文、武、成、康之遺風，諸侯復宗周。

translations.literal: King Xuan ascended the throne. The two ministers assisted him, repaired the government, and imitated the remaining customs of Wen, Wu, Cheng, and Kang. The feudal lords again revered Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan was established. The two ministers assisted him, repaired the government, and imitated the remaining customs of Wen, Wu, Cheng, and Kang. The lords again revered Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十二年，魯武公來朝。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Lu Wu Gong came to court.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Lu Wu Gong came to court.

translations.literal: Zhao Gong and Zhou Gong, the two ministers, administered the government. It was titled 'Republican.' In the fourteenth year of the Republican period, King Li died at Zhi. Crown prince Jing grew up in Zhao Gong's home. The two ministers then jointly established him as king. He was called King Xuan. King Xuan ascended the throne. The two ministers assisted him, repaired the government, and imitated the remaining customs of Wen, Wu, Cheng, and Kang. The feudal lords again revered Zhou. In the twelfth year, Lu Wu Gong came to court.

sentences.zh: 宣王不修籍於千畝，虢文公諫曰不可，王弗聽。

translations.literal: King Xuan did not repair the registry at the thousand mu. Guo Wen Gong advised that it was not possible. The king did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan did not repair the registry at the thousand mu. Guo Wen Gong advised that it was not possible. The king did not listen.

sentences.zh: 三十九年，戰于千畝，王師敗績于姜氏之戎。

translations.literal: In the thirty-ninth year, they fought at the thousand mu. The king's army was defeated by the Jiang clan Rong.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-ninth year, they fought at the thousand mu. The king's army was defeated by the Jiang clan Rong.

translations.literal: King Xuan did not repair the registry at the thousand mu. Guo Wen Gong advised that it was not possible. The king did not listen. In the thirty-ninth year, they fought at the thousand mu. The king's army was defeated by the Jiang clan Rong.

sentences.zh: 宣王既亡南國之師，乃料民於太原。

translations.literal: King Xuan had already lost the army of the southern states, so he tallied the people at Taiyuan.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan had already lost the army of the southern states, so he tallied the people at Taiyuan.

sentences.zh: 仲山甫諫曰：「民不可料也。」

translations.literal: Zhong Shan Fu advised: 'People cannot be tallied.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Shan Fu advised: 'The people cannot be tallied.'

sentences.zh: 宣王不聽，卒料民。

translations.literal: King Xuan did not listen. He finally tallied the people.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan did not listen. He finally tallied the people.

translations.literal: King Xuan had already lost the army of the southern states, so he tallied the people at Taiyuan. Zhong Shan Fu advised: 'The people cannot be tallied.' King Xuan did not listen. He finally tallied the people.

sentences.zh: 四十六年，宣王崩，子幽王宮湦立。

translations.literal: In the forty-sixth year, King Xuan collapsed. His son King You Gong Ning was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-sixth year, King Xuan collapsed. His son King You Gong Ning was established.

sentences.zh: 幽王二年，西周三川皆震。

translations.literal: In King You's second year, all three rivers of western Zhou shook.
translations.idiomatic: In King You's second year, all three rivers of western Zhou shook.

sentences.zh: 伯陽甫曰：「周將亡矣。

translations.literal: Bo Yang Fu said: 'Zhou will perish.
translations.idiomatic: Bo Yang Fu said: 'Zhou will perish.

sentences.zh: 夫天地之氣，不失其序；

translations.literal: Indeed heaven earth qi, not lose their order;
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the qi of heaven and earth does not lose its order;

sentences.zh: 若過其序，民亂之也。

translations.literal: If it exceeds its order, the people have caused the chaos.
translations.idiomatic: If it exceeds its order, the people have caused the chaos.

sentences.zh: 陽伏而不能出，陰迫而不能蒸，於是有地震。

translations.literal: When yang is hidden and cannot emerge, yin is pressed and cannot steam, then there are earthquakes.
translations.idiomatic: When yang is hidden and cannot emerge, yin is pressed and cannot steam, then there are earthquakes.

sentences.zh: 今三川實震，是陽失其所而填陰也。

translations.literal: Now the three rivers actually shake—this is yang losing its place and filling yin.
translations.idiomatic: Now the three rivers actually shake—this is yang losing its place and filling yin.

sentences.zh: 陽失而在陰，原必塞；

translations.literal: Yang lost and in yin, sources certainly blocked;
translations.idiomatic: When yang is lost and in yin, the sources are certainly blocked;

sentences.zh: 原塞，國必亡。

translations.literal: When sources are blocked, the state certainly perishes.
translations.idiomatic: When sources are blocked, the state certainly perishes.

sentences.zh: 夫水土演而民用也。

translations.literal: Indeed, when water and earth spread, the people use them.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, when water and earth spread, the people use them.

sentences.zh: 土無所演，民乏財用，不亡何待！

translations.literal: Earth nowhere spread, people lack wealth use, not perish what wait!
translations.idiomatic: When earth spreads nowhere, the people lack wealth and use. If it does not perish, what does it wait for!

sentences.zh: 昔伊、洛竭而夏亡，河竭而商亡。

translations.literal: Formerly when the Yi and Luo dried up, Xia perished. When the river dried up, Shang perished.
translations.idiomatic: Formerly when the Yi and Luo dried up, Xia perished. When the river dried up, Shang perished.

sentences.zh: 今周德若二代之季矣，其川原又塞，塞必竭。

translations.literal: Now Zhou's virtue is like the end of the two dynasties. Their rivers and sources are again blocked. When blocked, they certainly dry up.
translations.idiomatic: Now Zhou's virtue is like the end of the two dynasties. Their rivers and sources are again blocked. When blocked, they certainly dry up.

sentences.zh: 夫國必依山川，山崩川竭，亡國之徵也。

translations.literal: Indeed, states certainly rely on mountains and rivers. Mountains collapsing and rivers drying are omens of a perished state.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, states certainly rely on mountains and rivers. Mountains collapsing and rivers drying are omens of a perished state.

sentences.zh: 川竭必山崩。

translations.literal: When rivers dry, mountains certainly collapse.
translations.idiomatic: When rivers dry, mountains certainly collapse.

sentences.zh: 若國亡不過十年，數之紀也。

translations.literal: If the state perishes, it will not exceed ten years—the record of numbers.
translations.idiomatic: If the state perishes, it will not exceed ten years—the record of numbers.

sentences.zh: 天之所棄，不過其紀。」

translations.literal: Heaven what abandoned, not exceed its record.'
translations.idiomatic: What heaven has abandoned does not exceed its record.'

sentences.zh: 是歲也，三川竭，岐山崩。

translations.literal: This year, the three rivers dried up and Mount Qi collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: This year, the three rivers dried up and Mount Qi collapsed.

translations.literal: In the forty-sixth year, King Xuan collapsed. His son King You Gong Ning was established. In King You's second year, all three rivers of western Zhou shook. Bo Yang Fu said: 'Zhou will perish. Indeed, the qi of heaven and earth does not lose its order; If it exceeds its order, the people have caused the chaos. When yang is hidden and cannot emerge, yin is pressed and cannot steam, then there are earthquakes. Now the three rivers actually shake—this is yang losing its place and filling yin. When yang is lost and in yin, the sources are certainly blocked; When sources are blocked, the state certainly perishes. Indeed, when water and earth spread, the people use them. When earth spreads nowhere, the people lack wealth and use. If it does not perish, what does it wait for! Formerly when the Yi and Luo dried up, Xia perished. When the river dried up, Shang perished. Now Zhou's virtue is like the end of the two dynasties. Their rivers and sources are again blocked. When blocked, they certainly dry up. Indeed, states certainly rely on mountains and rivers. Mountains collapsing and rivers drying are omens of a perished state. When rivers dry, mountains certainly collapse. If the state perishes, it will not exceed ten years—the record of numbers. What heaven has abandoned does not exceed its record.' This year, the three rivers dried up and Mount Qi collapsed.

sentences.zh: 三年，幽王嬖愛褒姒。

translations.literal: In the third year, King You favored and loved Bao Si.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, King You favored and loved Bao Si.

sentences.zh: 褒姒生子伯服，幽王欲廢太子。

translations.literal: Bao Si gave birth to a son named Bo Fu. King You wished to depose the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Bao Si gave birth to a son named Bo Fu. King You wished to depose the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子母申侯女，而為后。

translations.literal: The crown prince's mother was a woman of Shen Hou, and she was the queen.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince's mother was a woman of Shen Hou, and she was the queen.

sentences.zh: 後幽王得褒姒，愛之，欲廢申后，并去太子宜臼，以褒姒為后，以伯服為太子。

translations.literal: Later King You got Bao Si and loved her. He wished to depose the Shen queen and remove the crown prince Yi Jiu, making Bao Si the queen and Bo Fu the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Later King You got Bao Si and loved her. He wished to depose the Shen queen and remove the crown prince Yi Jiu, making Bao Si the queen and Bo Fu the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 周太史伯陽讀史記曰：「周亡矣。」

translations.literal: Zhou grand historian Bo Yang read history records said: 'Zhou perished.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou's grand historian Bo Yang read the history records and said: 'Zhou has perished.'

sentences.zh: 昔自夏后氏之衰也，有二神龍止於夏帝庭而言曰：「余，褒之二君。」

translations.literal: Formerly from Xia Hou clan decline, had two spirit dragons stopped at Xia emperor court and spoke: 'We, Bao two lords.'
translations.idiomatic: Formerly, when the Xia Hou clan declined, two spirit dragons stopped in the Xia emperor's court and spoke, saying: 'We are Bao's two lords.'

sentences.zh: 夏帝卜殺之與去之與止之，莫吉。

translations.literal: The Xia emperor divined whether to kill them, drive them away, or let them stay. None were auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: The Xia emperor divined whether to kill them, drive them away, or let them stay. None were auspicious.

sentences.zh: 卜請其漦而藏之，乃吉。

translations.literal: He divined to request their saliva and store it, and then it was auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: He divined to request their saliva and store it, and then it was auspicious.

sentences.zh: 於是布幣而策告之，龍亡而漦在，櫝而去之。

translations.literal: Thus he spread silks and bamboo to announce it. The dragons were gone but the saliva remained. He boxed it and removed it.
translations.idiomatic: Thus he spread silks and bamboo to announce it. The dragons were gone but the saliva remained. He boxed it and removed it.

sentences.zh: 夏亡，傳此器殷。

translations.literal: Xia perished, and this vessel was passed to Yin.
translations.idiomatic: Xia perished, and this vessel was passed to Yin.

sentences.zh: 殷亡，又傳此器周。

translations.literal: Yin perished, and this vessel was again passed to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Yin perished, and this vessel was again passed to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 比三代，莫敢發之，至厲王之末，發而觀之。

translations.literal: Compared to the three dynasties, none dared open it. Until the end of King Li's reign, it was opened and viewed.
translations.idiomatic: Compared to the three dynasties, none dared open it. Until the end of King Li's reign, it was opened and viewed.

sentences.zh: 漦流于庭，不可除。

translations.literal: The saliva flowed in the court and could not be removed.
translations.idiomatic: The saliva flowed in the court and could not be removed.

sentences.zh: 厲王使婦人裸而譟之。

translations.literal: King Li made women go naked and shout at it.
translations.idiomatic: King Li made women go naked and shout at it.

sentences.zh: 漦化為玄黿，以入王後宮。

translations.literal: The saliva transformed into a black turtle and entered the king's harem.
translations.idiomatic: The saliva transformed into a black turtle and entered the king's harem.

sentences.zh: 後宮之童妾既齔而遭之，既笄而孕，無夫而生子，懼而棄之。

translations.literal: A young concubine in the harem, already with teeth, encountered it. Already with hairpin, she became pregnant. Without a husband, she gave birth to a son. She feared it and abandoned him.
translations.idiomatic: A young concubine in the harem, already with teeth, encountered it. Already with hairpin, she became pregnant. Without a husband, she gave birth to a son. She feared it and abandoned him.

sentences.zh: 宣王之時童女謠曰：「厭弧箕服，實亡周國。」

translations.literal: Xuan Wang time young girl rhyme said: 'Bows bent Ji served, actually perished Zhou state.'
translations.idiomatic: In King Xuan's time, a young girl made a rhyme saying: 'Bows are bent, Ji is served—it actually perishes the Zhou state.'

sentences.zh: 於是宣王聞之，有夫婦賣是器者，宣王使執而戮之。

translations.literal: Thus King Xuan heard of it. There was a couple selling this vessel. King Xuan had them seized and executed.
translations.idiomatic: Thus King Xuan heard of it. There was a couple selling this vessel. King Xuan had them seized and executed.

sentences.zh: 逃於道，而見鄉者後宮童妾所棄妖子出於路者，聞其夜啼，哀而收之，夫婦遂亡，奔於褒。

translations.literal: They fled on the road and saw a villager's harem young concubine abandoned monster child emerged on the road. They heard its night crying, pitied it and took it. The couple then fled and ran to Bao.
translations.idiomatic: They fled on the road and saw a villager's harem young concubine abandoned monster child emerged on the road. They heard its night crying, pitied it and took it. The couple then fled and ran to Bao.

sentences.zh: 褒人有罪，請入童妾所棄女子者於王以贖罪。

translations.literal: A Bao person had committed a crime. He requested to present the young concubine abandoned girl to the king to redeem his crime.
translations.idiomatic: A Bao person had committed a crime. He requested to present the young concubine abandoned girl to the king to redeem his crime.

sentences.zh: 棄女子出於褒，是為褒姒。

translations.literal: The abandoned girl emerged from Bao. She was Bao Si.
translations.idiomatic: The abandoned girl emerged from Bao. She was Bao Si.

sentences.zh: 當幽王三年，王之後宮見而愛之，生子伯服，竟廢申后及太子，以褒姒為后，伯服為太子。

translations.literal: During King You's third year, the king's harem saw her and loved her. She gave birth to a son named Bo Fu. He finally deposed the Shen queen and crown prince, making Bao Si the queen and Bo Fu the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: During King You's third year, the king's harem saw her and loved her. She gave birth to a son named Bo Fu. He finally deposed the Shen queen and crown prince, making Bao Si the queen and Bo Fu the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太史伯陽曰：「禍成矣，無可奈何！」

translations.literal: Grand Historian Bo Yang said: 'Disaster completed, nothing can do!'
translations.idiomatic: Grand Historian Bo Yang said: 'The disaster is complete. Nothing can be done!'

translations.literal: In the third year, King You favored and loved Bao Si. Bao Si gave birth to a son named Bo Fu. King You wished to depose the crown prince. The crown prince's mother was a woman of Shen Hou, and she was the queen. Later King You got Bao Si and loved her. He wished to depose the Shen queen and remove the crown prince Yi Jiu, making Bao Si the queen and Bo Fu the crown prince. Zhou's grand historian Bo Yang read the history records and said: 'Zhou has perished.' Formerly, when the Xia Hou clan declined, two spirit dragons stopped in the Xia emperor's court and spoke, saying: 'We are Bao's two lords.' The Xia emperor divined whether to kill them, drive them away, or let them stay. None were auspicious. He divined to request their saliva and store it, and then it was auspicious. Thus he spread silks and bamboo to announce it. The dragons were gone but the saliva remained. He boxed it and removed it. Xia perished, and this vessel was passed to Yin. Yin perished, and this vessel was again passed to Zhou. Compared to the three dynasties, none dared open it. Until the end of King Li's reign, it was opened and viewed. The saliva flowed in the court and could not be removed. King Li made women go naked and shout at it. The saliva transformed into a black turtle and entered the king's harem. A young concubine in the harem, already with teeth, encountered it. Already with hairpin, she became pregnant. Without a husband, she gave birth to a son. She feared it and abandoned him. In King Xuan's time, a young girl made a rhyme saying: 'Bows are bent, Ji is served—it actually perishes the Zhou state.' Thus King Xuan heard of it. There was a couple selling this vessel. King Xuan had them seized and executed. They fled on the road and saw a villager's harem young concubine abandoned monster child emerged on the road. They heard its night crying, pitied it and took it. The couple then fled and ran to Bao. A Bao person had committed a crime. He requested to present the young concubine abandoned girl to the king to redeem his crime. The abandoned girl emerged from Bao. She was Bao Si. During King You's third year, the king's harem saw her and loved her. She gave birth to a son named Bo Fu. He finally deposed the Shen queen and crown prince, making Bao Si the queen and Bo Fu the crown prince. Grand Historian Bo Yang said: 'The disaster is complete. Nothing can be done!'

sentences.zh: 褒姒不好笑，幽王欲其笑萬方，故不笑。

translations.literal: Bao Si was not good at laughing. King You wished her to laugh in ten thousand ways, so she did not laugh.
translations.idiomatic: Bao Si was not good at laughing. King You wished her to laugh in ten thousand ways, so she did not laugh.

sentences.zh: 幽王為烽燧大鼓，有寇至則舉烽火。

translations.literal: King You made beacon fires and great drums. When bandits arrived, they would raise the beacon fires.
translations.idiomatic: King You made beacon fires and great drums. When bandits arrived, they would raise the beacon fires.

sentences.zh: 諸侯悉至，至而無寇，褒姒乃大笑。

translations.literal: All the feudal lords arrived. They arrived and there were no bandits. Bao Si then greatly laughed.
translations.idiomatic: All the lords arrived. They arrived and there were no bandits. Bao Si then greatly laughed.

sentences.zh: 幽王說之，為數舉烽火。

translations.literal: King You was pleased by it. He raised the beacon fires several times.
translations.idiomatic: King You was pleased by it. He raised the beacon fires several times.

sentences.zh: 其後不信，諸侯益亦不至。

translations.literal: Afterwards it was not trusted. The feudal lords increasingly also did not come.
translations.idiomatic: Afterwards it was not trusted. The lords increasingly also did not come.

translations.literal: Bao Si was not good at laughing. King You wished her to laugh in ten thousand ways, so she did not laugh. King You made beacon fires and great drums. When bandits arrived, they would raise the beacon fires. All the feudal lords arrived. They arrived and there were no bandits. Bao Si then greatly laughed. King You was pleased by it. He raised the beacon fires several times. Afterwards it was not trusted. The feudal lords increasingly also did not come.

sentences.zh: 幽王以虢石父為卿，用事，國人皆怨。

translations.literal: King You made Guo Shi Fu the chief minister to handle affairs. All the people of the state resented this.
translations.idiomatic: King You made Guo Shi Fu the chief minister to handle affairs. All the people of the state resented this.

sentences.zh: 石父為人佞巧善諛好利，王用之。

translations.literal: Shi Fu as a person was flattering and clever, good at flattery and liked profit. The king used him.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Fu as a person was flattering and clever, good at flattery and liked profit. The king used him.

sentences.zh: 又廢申后，去太子也。

translations.literal: He again deposed the Shen queen and removed the crown prince as well.
translations.idiomatic: He again deposed the Shen queen and removed the crown prince as well.

sentences.zh: 申侯怒，與繒、西夷犬戎攻幽王。

translations.literal: Shen Hou was angry. Together with Zeng and the western Yi Quanrong, he attacked King You.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Hou was angry. Together with Zeng and the western Yi Quanrong, he attacked King You.

sentences.zh: 幽王舉烽火徵兵，兵莫至。

translations.literal: King You raised the beacon fires to summon troops. No troops arrived.
translations.idiomatic: King You raised the beacon fires to summon troops. No troops arrived.

sentences.zh: 遂殺幽王驪山下，虜褒姒，盡取周賂而去。

translations.literal: Then they killed King You below Mount Li, captured Bao Si, completely took Zhou's treasures and left.
translations.idiomatic: Then they killed King You below Mount Li, captured Bao Si, completely took Zhou's treasures and left.

sentences.zh: 於是諸侯乃即申侯而共立故幽王太子宜臼，是為平王，以奉周祀。

translations.literal: Thus the feudal lords then approached Shen Hou and jointly established the former King You's crown prince Yi Jiu. He was Ping Wang, to serve the Zhou sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the feudal feudal lords then approached Shen Hou and jointly enthroned the former King You's crown prince Yi Jiu. He was Ping Wang, to serve the Zhou sacrifices.

translations.literal: King You made Guo Shi Fu the chief minister to handle affairs. All the people of the state resented this. Shi Fu as a person was flattering and clever, good at flattery and liked profit. The king used him. He again deposed the Shen queen and removed the crown prince as well. Shen Hou was angry. Together with Zeng and the western Yi Quanrong, he attacked King You. King You raised the beacon fires to summon troops. No troops arrived. Then they killed King You below Mount Li, captured Bao Si, completely took Zhou's treasures and left. Thus the feudal lords then approached Shen Hou and jointly established the former King You's crown prince Yi Jiu. He was Ping Wang, to serve the Zhou sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 平王立，東遷于雒邑，辟戎寇。

translations.literal: King Ping was established. He moved east to Luoyi to avoid the Rong bandits.
translations.idiomatic: King Ping ascended the throne. He moved east to Luoyi to avoid the Rong bandits.

sentences.zh: 平王之時，周室衰微，諸侯彊并弱，齊、楚、秦、晉始大，政由方伯。

translations.literal: In King Ping's time, the Zhou house declined and weakened. The feudal lords—the strong annexed the weak. Qi, Chu, Qin, and Jin began to grow great. Government came from the regional lords.
translations.idiomatic: In King Ping's time, the Zhou house declined and weakened. The feudal feudal lords—the strong annexed the weak. Qi, Chu, Qin, and Jin began to grow great. Government came from the regional feudal lords.

translations.literal: King Ping was established. He moved east to Luoyi to avoid the Rong bandits. In King Ping's time, the Zhou house declined and weakened. The feudal lords—the strong annexed the weak. Qi, Chu, Qin, and Jin began to grow great. Government came from the regional lords.

sentences.zh: 四十九年，魯隱公即位。

translations.literal: In the forty-ninth year, Duke Yin of Lu took the throne.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-ninth year, Lord Yin of Lu took the throne.

translations.literal: In the forty-ninth year, Duke Yin of Lu took the throne.

sentences.zh: 五十一年，平王崩，太子洩父蚤死，立其子林，是為桓王。

translations.literal: In the fifty-first year, King Ping collapsed. The crown prince Xie Fu had died early. They established his son Lin. He was King Huan.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-first year, King Ping collapsed. The crown prince Xie Fu had passed away early. They enthroned his son Lin. He was King Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓王，平王孫也。

translations.literal: King Huan was King Ping's grandson.
translations.idiomatic: King Huan was King Ping's grandson.

translations.literal: In the fifty-first year, King Ping collapsed. The crown prince Xie Fu had died early. They established his son Lin. He was King Huan. King Huan was King Ping's grandson.

sentences.zh: 桓王三年，鄭莊公朝，桓王不禮。

translations.literal: In King Huan's third year, Duke Zhuang of Zheng came to court. King Huan was not courteous.
translations.idiomatic: In King Huan's third year, Lord Zhuang of Zheng came to court. King Huan was not courteous.

sentences.zh: 五年，鄭怨，與魯易許田。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Zheng resented this and exchanged the Xu field with Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Zheng resented this and exchanged the Xu field with Lu.

sentences.zh: 許田，天子之用事太山田也。

translations.literal: The Xu field was the field where the Son of Heaven handled affairs at Mount Tai.
translations.idiomatic: The Xu field was the field where the Son of Heaven handled affairs at Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 八年，魯殺隱公，立桓公。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Lu killed Duke Yin and established Duke Huan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Lu killed Lord Yin and enthroned Lord Huan.

sentences.zh: 十三年，伐鄭，鄭射傷桓王，桓王去歸。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, they attacked Zheng. Zheng shot and wounded King Huan. King Huan left and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, they attacked Zheng. Zheng shot and wounded King Huan. King Huan left and returned.

translations.literal: In King Huan's third year, Duke Zhuang of Zheng came to court. King Huan was not courteous. In the fifth year, Zheng resented this and exchanged the Xu field with Lu. The Xu field was the field where the Son of Heaven handled affairs at Mount Tai. In the eighth year, Lu killed Duke Yin and established Duke Huan. In the thirteenth year, they attacked Zheng. Zheng shot and wounded King Huan. King Huan left and returned.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，桓王崩，子莊王佗立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, King Huan collapsed. His son King Zhuang Tuo was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, King Huan collapsed. His son King Zhuang Tuo ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 莊王四年，周公黑肩欲殺莊王而立王子克。

translations.literal: In King Zhuang's fourth year, Zhou Gong Hei Jian wished to kill King Zhuang and establish Prince Ke.
translations.idiomatic: In King Zhuang's fourth year, Zhou Gong Hei Jian wished to kill King Zhuang and establish Prince Ke.

sentences.zh: 辛伯告王，王殺周公。

translations.literal: Xin Bo told the king. The king killed Zhou Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Xin Bo told the king. The king killed Zhou Gong.

sentences.zh: 王子克奔燕。

translations.literal: Prince Ke fled to Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Prince Ke fled to Yan.

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, King Huan collapsed. His son King Zhuang Tuo was established. In King Zhuang's fourth year, Zhou Gong Hei Jian wished to kill King Zhuang and establish Prince Ke. Xin Bo told the king. The king killed Zhou Gong. Prince Ke fled to Yan.

sentences.zh: 十五年，莊王崩，子釐王胡齊立。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, King Zhuang collapsed. His son King Xi Hu Qi was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, King Zhuang collapsed. His son King Xi Hu Qi ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 釐王三年，齊桓公始霸。

translations.literal: In King Xi's third year, Duke Huan of Qi began his hegemony.
translations.idiomatic: In King Xi's third year, Lord Huan of Qi began his hegemony.

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, King Zhuang collapsed. His son King Xi Hu Qi was established. In King Xi's third year, Duke Huan of Qi began his hegemony.

sentences.zh: 五年，釐王崩，子惠王閬立。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, King Xi collapsed. His son King Hui Lang was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, King Xi collapsed. His son King Hui Lang ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 惠王二年。

translations.literal: King Hui's second year.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui's second year.

sentences.zh: 初，莊王嬖姬姚，生子穨，穨有寵。

translations.literal: Initially, King Zhuang favored his concubine Yao. She gave birth to a son named Sui. Sui had favor.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, King Zhuang favored his concubine Yao. She gave birth to a son named Sui. Sui had favor.

sentences.zh: 及惠王即位，奪其大臣以為囿，故大夫邊伯等五人作亂，謀召燕、衛師，伐惠王。

translations.literal: When King Hui took the throne, he seized his great minister's land to make a park. Therefore five great ministers including Bian Bo made rebellion. They plotted to summon Yan and Wei armies to attack King Hui.
translations.idiomatic: When King Hui took the throne, he seized his great minister's land to make a park. Therefore five great ministers including Bian Bo made rebellion. They plotted to summon Yan and Wei armies to attack King Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠王犇溫，已居鄭之櫟。

translations.literal: King Hui fled to Wen, and already resided in Zheng's Li.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui fled to Wen, and already resided in Zheng's Li.

sentences.zh: 立釐王弟穨為王。

translations.literal: They established King Xi's younger brother Sui as king.
translations.idiomatic: They enthroned King Xi's younger brother Sui as king.

sentences.zh: 樂及徧舞，鄭、虢君怒。

translations.literal: The music reached universal dance. The lords of Zheng and Guo were angry.
translations.idiomatic: The music reached universal dance. The feudal lords of Zheng and Guo were angry.

sentences.zh: 四年，鄭與虢君伐殺王穨，復入惠王。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Zheng together with the lord of Guo attacked and killed King Sui. They again entered King Hui.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Zheng together with the lord of Guo attacked and killed King Sui. They again entered King Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠王十年，賜齊桓公為伯。

translations.literal: In King Hui's tenth year, he granted Duke Huan of Qi the title of Bo.
