translations.idiomatic: In King Hui's tenth year, he granted Lord Huan of Qi the title of Bo.

translations.literal: In the fifth year, King Xi collapsed. His son King Hui Lang was established. King Hui's second year. Initially, King Zhuang favored his concubine Yao. She gave birth to a son named Sui. Sui had favor. When King Hui took the throne, he seized his great minister's land to make a park. Therefore five great ministers including Bian Bo made rebellion. They plotted to summon Yan and Wei armies to attack King Hui. King Hui fled to Wen, and already resided in Zheng's Li. They established King Xi's younger brother Sui as king. The music reached universal dance. The lords of Zheng and Guo were angry. In the fourth year, Zheng together with the lord of Guo attacked and killed King Sui. They again entered King Hui. In King Hui's tenth year, he granted Duke Huan of Qi the title of Bo.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，惠王崩，子襄王鄭立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, King Hui collapsed. His son King Xiang Zheng was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, King Hui collapsed. His son King Xiang Zheng ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 襄王母蚤死，後母曰惠后。

translations.literal: King Xiang's mother died early. His stepmother was called Empress Hui.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang's mother passed away early. His stepmother was called Empress Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠后生叔帶，有寵於惠王，襄王畏之。

translations.literal: Empress Hui gave birth to Uncle Dai. He had favor with King Hui. King Xiang feared him.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Hui gave birth to Uncle Dai. He had favor with King Hui. King Xiang feared him.

sentences.zh: 三年，叔帶與戎、翟謀伐襄王，襄王欲誅叔帶，叔帶奔齊。

translations.literal: In the third year, Uncle Dai together with the Rong and Di plotted to attack King Xiang. King Xiang wished to execute Uncle Dai. Uncle Dai fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Uncle Dai together with the Rong and Di plotted to attack King Xiang. King Xiang wished to execute Uncle Dai. Uncle Dai fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公使管仲平戎于周，使隰朋平戎于晉。

translations.literal: Duke Huan of Qi sent Guan Zhong to pacify the Rong at Zhou and sent Xi Peng to pacify the Rong at Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Huan of Qi sent Guan Zhong to pacify the Rong at Zhou and sent Xi Peng to pacify the Rong at Jin.

sentences.zh: 王以上卿禮管仲。

translations.literal: The king treated Guan Zhong with the rites of an upper minister.
translations.idiomatic: The king treated Guan Zhong with the rites of an upper minister.

sentences.zh: 管仲辭曰：「臣賤有司也，有天子之二守國、高在。

translations.literal: Guan Zhong declined said: 'Minister lowly official also, have Son of Heaven two guardians Guo, Gao present.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong declined and said: 'Your minister is a lowly official. The Son of Heaven has two guardians—Guo and Gao are present.

sentences.zh: 若節春秋來承王命，何以禮焉。

translations.literal: If I come according to the seasons of spring and autumn to receive the king's commands, how should I be treated with rites?
translations.idiomatic: If I come according to the seasons of spring and autumn to receive the king's commands, how should I be treated with rites?

sentences.zh: 陪臣敢辭。」

translations.literal: Attendant minister dares decline.'
translations.idiomatic: This attendant minister dares to decline.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「舅氏，余嘉乃勳，毋逆朕命。」

translations.literal: King said: 'Maternal uncle, I praise your merits, do not oppose my commands.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Maternal uncle, I praise your merits. Do not oppose my commands.'

sentences.zh: 管仲卒受下卿之禮而還。

translations.literal: Guan Zhong finally accepted the rites of a lower minister and returned.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong finally accepted the rites of a lower minister and returned.

sentences.zh: 九年，齊桓公卒。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Duke Huan of Qi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Lord Huan of Qi passed away.

sentences.zh: 十二年，叔帶復歸于周。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Uncle Dai again returned to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Uncle Dai again returned to Zhou.

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, King Hui collapsed. His son King Xiang Zheng was established. King Xiang's mother died early. His stepmother was called Empress Hui. Empress Hui gave birth to Uncle Dai. He had favor with King Hui. King Xiang feared him. In the third year, Uncle Dai together with the Rong and Di plotted to attack King Xiang. King Xiang wished to execute Uncle Dai. Uncle Dai fled to Qi. Duke Huan of Qi sent Guan Zhong to pacify the Rong at Zhou and sent Xi Peng to pacify the Rong at Jin. The king treated Guan Zhong with the rites of an upper minister. Guan Zhong declined and said: 'Your minister is a lowly official. The Son of Heaven has two guardians—Guo and Gao are present. If I come according to the seasons of spring and autumn to receive the king's commands, how should I be treated with rites? This attendant minister dares to decline.' The king said: 'Maternal uncle, I praise your merits. Do not oppose my commands.' Guan Zhong finally accepted the rites of a lower minister and returned. In the ninth year, Duke Huan of Qi died. In the twelfth year, Uncle Dai again returned to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十三年，鄭伐滑，王使游孫、伯服請滑，鄭人囚之。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Zheng attacked Hua. The king sent You Sun and Bo Fu to petition for Hua. The Zheng people imprisoned them.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Zheng attacked Hua. The king sent You Sun and Bo Fu to petition for Hua. The Zheng people imprisoned them.

sentences.zh: 鄭文公怨惠王之入不與厲公爵，又怨襄王之與衛滑，故囚伯服。

translations.literal: Duke Wen of Zheng resented that King Hui's entry did not give nobility to Duke Li, and also resented that King Xiang gave Wei Hua. Therefore he imprisoned Bo Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Wen of Zheng resented that King Hui's entry did not give nobility to Lord Li, and also resented that King Xiang gave Wei Hua. Therefore he imprisoned Bo Fu.

sentences.zh: 王怒，將以翟伐鄭。

translations.literal: The king was angry. He would attack Zheng with the Di.
translations.idiomatic: The king was angry. He would attack Zheng with the Di.

sentences.zh: 富辰諫曰：「凡我周之東徙，晉、鄭焉依。

translations.literal: Fu Chen advised said: 'All our Zhou east migration, Jin, Zheng where relied.
translations.idiomatic: Fu Chen advised and said: 'For all our Zhou's eastern migration, Jin and Zheng are what we relied on.

sentences.zh: 子穨之亂，又鄭之由定，今以小怨棄之！」

translations.literal: Zi Sui rebellion, also Zheng what stabilized, now with small resentment abandon it!'
translations.idiomatic: For Zi Sui's rebellion, Zheng was what stabilized it. Now with small resentment we abandon it!'

sentences.zh: 王不聽。

translations.literal: The king did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: The king did not listen.

sentences.zh: 十五年，王降翟師以伐鄭。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, the king brought down Di armies to attack Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, the king brought down Di armies to attack Zheng.

sentences.zh: 王德翟人，將以其女為后。

translations.literal: The king favored the Di people. He would take their daughter as queen.
translations.idiomatic: The king favored the Di people. He would take their daughter as queen.

sentences.zh: 富辰諫曰：「平、桓、莊、惠皆受鄭勞，王棄親親翟，不可從。」

translations.literal: Fu Chen advised said: 'Ping, Huan, Zhuang, Hui all received Zheng toil, king abandons close-close Di, cannot follow.'
translations.idiomatic: Fu Chen advised and said: 'Kings Ping, Huan, Zhuang, and Hui all received toil from Zheng. The king abandons his close kin for the Di—this cannot be followed.'

sentences.zh: 王不聽。

translations.literal: The king did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: The king did not listen.

sentences.zh: 十六年，王絀翟后，翟人來誅，殺譚伯。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, the king deposed the Di queen. The Di people came to punish him and killed Tan Bo.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, the king deposed the Di queen. The Di people came to punish him and killed Tan Bo.

sentences.zh: 富辰曰：「吾數諫不從。

translations.literal: Fu Chen said: 'I repeatedly advised not followed.
translations.idiomatic: Fu Chen said: 'I repeatedly advised but was not followed.

sentences.zh: 如是不出，王以我為懟乎？」

translations.literal: If like this not go out, king with me as resentful?'
translations.idiomatic: If I don't go out like this, will the king resent me?'

sentences.zh: 乃以其屬死之。

translations.literal: Then with his followers he died for it.
translations.idiomatic: Then with his followers he passed away for it.

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Zheng attacked Hua. The king sent You Sun and Bo Fu to petition for Hua. The Zheng people imprisoned them. Duke Wen of Zheng resented that King Hui's entry did not give nobility to Duke Li, and also resented that King Xiang gave Wei Hua. Therefore he imprisoned Bo Fu. The king was angry. He would attack Zheng with the Di. Fu Chen advised and said: 'For all our Zhou's eastern migration, Jin and Zheng are what we relied on. For Zi Sui's rebellion, Zheng was what stabilized it. Now with small resentment we abandon it!' The king did not listen. In the fifteenth year, the king brought down Di armies to attack Zheng. The king favored the Di people. He would take their daughter as queen. Fu Chen advised and said: 'Kings Ping, Huan, Zhuang, and Hui all received toil from Zheng. The king abandons his close kin for the Di—this cannot be followed.' The king did not listen. In the sixteenth year, the king deposed the Di queen. The Di people came to punish him and killed Tan Bo. Fu Chen said: 'I repeatedly advised but was not followed. If I don't go out like this, will the king resent me?' Then with his followers he died for it.

sentences.zh: 初，惠后欲立王子帶，故以黨開翟人，翟人遂入周。

translations.literal: Initially, Empress Hui wished to establish Prince Dai. Therefore with her faction she opened the way for the Di people. The Di people then entered Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Empress Hui wished to establish Prince Dai. Therefore with her faction she opened the way for the Di people. The Di people then entered Zhou.

sentences.zh: 襄王出奔鄭，鄭居王于汜。

translations.literal: King Xiang fled to Zheng. Zheng housed the king at Si.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang fled to Zheng. Zheng housed the king at Si.

sentences.zh: 子帶立為王，取襄王所絀翟后與居溫。

translations.literal: Zi Dai was established as king. He took the Di queen whom Xiang Wang had deposed and resided with her at Wen.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Dai was established as king. He took the Di queen whom Xiang Wang had deposed and resided with her at Wen.

sentences.zh: 十七年，襄王告急于晉，晉文公納王而誅叔帶。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, King Xiang urgently appealed to Jin. Duke Wen of Jin received the king and executed Uncle Dai.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, King Xiang urgently appealed to Jin. Duke Wen of Jin received the king and executed Uncle Dai.

sentences.zh: 襄王乃賜晉文公珪鬯弓矢，為伯，以河內地與晉。

translations.literal: King Xiang then granted Duke Wen of Jin the gui, chang, bow, and arrows, making him Bo. He gave the land within the Yellow River to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang then granted Duke Wen of Jin the gui, chang, bow, and arrows, making him Bo. He gave the land within the Yellow River to Jin.

sentences.zh: 二十年，晉文公召襄王，襄王會之河陽、踐土，諸侯畢朝，書諱曰「天王狩于河陽」。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, Jin Wen Gong summoned Xiang Wang, Xiang Wang met him at Heyang, Jiantu, feudal lords all court, annals avoided said 'Heavenly King hunted at Heyang'.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Duke Wen of Jin summoned King Xiang. King Xiang met him at Heyang and Jiantu. All the feudal lords came to court. The annals euphemistically said 'The Heavenly King hunted at Heyang'.

translations.literal: Initially, Empress Hui wished to establish Prince Dai. Therefore with her faction she opened the way for the Di people. The Di people then entered Zhou. King Xiang fled to Zheng. Zheng housed the king at Si. Zi Dai was established as king. He took the Di queen whom Xiang Wang had deposed and resided with her at Wen. In the seventeenth year, King Xiang urgently appealed to Jin. Duke Wen of Jin received the king and executed Uncle Dai. King Xiang then granted Duke Wen of Jin the gui, chang, bow, and arrows, making him Bo. He gave the land within the Yellow River to Jin. In the twentieth year, Duke Wen of Jin summoned King Xiang. King Xiang met him at Heyang and Jiantu. All the feudal lords came to court. The annals euphemistically said 'The Heavenly King hunted at Heyang'.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，晉文公卒。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Wen of Jin died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Wen of Jin died.

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Wen of Jin died.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，秦穆公卒。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Duke Mu of Qin died.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Duke Mu of Qin died.

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Duke Mu of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，襄王崩，子頃王壬臣立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-second year, King Xiang collapsed. His son King Qing Ren Chen was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, King Xiang collapsed. His son King Qing Ren Chen was established.

sentences.zh: 頃王六年，崩，子匡王班立。

translations.literal: In King Qing's sixth year, he collapsed. His son King Kuang Ban was established.
translations.idiomatic: In King Qing's sixth year, he collapsed. His son King Kuang Ban was established.

sentences.zh: 匡王六年，崩，弟瑜立，是為定王。

translations.literal: In King Kuang's sixth year, he collapsed. His younger brother Yu was established. He was King Ding.
translations.idiomatic: In King Kuang's sixth year, he collapsed. His younger brother Yu was established. He was King Ding.

translations.literal: In the thirty-second year, King Xiang collapsed. His son King Qing Ren Chen was established. In King Qing's sixth year, he collapsed. His son King Kuang Ban was established. In King Kuang's sixth year, he collapsed. His younger brother Yu was established. He was King Ding.

sentences.zh: 定王元年，楚莊王伐陸渾之戎，次洛，使人問九鼎。

translations.literal: In King Ding's first year, King Zhuang of Chu attacked the Rong of Luhun. He halted at the Luo and sent someone to ask about the nine tripods.
translations.idiomatic: In King Ding's first year, King Zhuang of Chu attacked the Rong of Luhun. He halted at the Luo and sent someone to ask about the nine tripods.

sentences.zh: 王使王孫滿應設以辭，楚兵乃去。

translations.literal: The king sent Wang Sun Man to respond with words. The Chu troops then left.
translations.idiomatic: The king sent Wang Sun Man to respond with words. The Chu troops then left.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚莊王圍鄭，鄭伯降，已而復之。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, King Zhuang of Chu surrounded Zheng. The lord of Zheng surrendered, but he soon restored it.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, King Zhuang of Chu surrounded Zheng. The lord of Zheng surrendered, but he soon restored it.

sentences.zh: 十六年，楚莊王卒。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, King Zhuang of Chu died.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, King Zhuang of Chu died.

translations.literal: In King Ding's first year, King Zhuang of Chu attacked the Rong of Luhun. He halted at the Luo and sent someone to ask about the nine tripods. The king sent Wang Sun Man to respond with words. The Chu troops then left. In the tenth year, King Zhuang of Chu surrounded Zheng. The lord of Zheng surrendered, but he soon restored it. In the sixteenth year, King Zhuang of Chu died.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，定王崩，子簡王夷立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, King Ding collapsed. His son King Jian Yi was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, King Ding collapsed. His son King Jian Yi was established.

sentences.zh: 簡王十三年，晉殺其君厲公，迎子周於周，立為悼公。

translations.literal: In King Jian's thirteenth year, Jin killed their ruler Duke Li. They welcomed Zi Zhou from Zhou and established him as Duke Dao.
translations.idiomatic: In King Jian's thirteenth year, Jin killed their ruler Duke Li. They welcomed Zi Zhou from Zhou and established him as Duke Dao.

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, King Ding collapsed. His son King Jian Yi was established. In King Jian's thirteenth year, Jin killed their ruler Duke Li. They welcomed Zi Zhou from Zhou and established him as Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 十四年，簡王崩，子靈王泄心立。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, King Jian collapsed. His son King Ling Xie Xin was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, King Jian collapsed. His son King Ling Xie Xin was established.

sentences.zh: 靈王二十四年，齊崔杼弒其君莊公。

translations.literal: In King Ling's twenty-fourth year, Cui Zhu of Qi assassinated their ruler Duke Zhuang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Ling's twenty-fourth year, Cui Zhu of Qi assassinated their ruler Duke Zhuang.

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, King Jian collapsed. His son King Ling Xie Xin was established. In King Ling's twenty-fourth year, Cui Zhu of Qi assassinated their ruler Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，靈王崩，子景王貴立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, King Ling collapsed. His son King Jing Gui was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, King Ling collapsed. His son King Jing Gui was established.

sentences.zh: 景王十八年，后太子聖而蚤卒。

translations.literal: In King Jing's eighteenth year, the queen's crown prince Sheng died early.
translations.idiomatic: In King Jing's eighteenth year, the queen's crown prince Sheng died early.

sentences.zh: 二十年，景王愛子朝，欲立之，會崩，子丐之黨與爭立，國人立長子猛為王，子朝攻殺猛。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, King Jing loved his son Zhao and wished to establish him. He happened to collapse. Zi Gai's faction contended for the establishment. The state people established the eldest son Meng as king. Zi Zhao attacked and killed Meng.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, King Jing loved his son Zhao and wished to establish him. He happened to collapse. Zi Gai's faction contended for the establishment. The state people established the eldest son Meng as king. Zi Zhao attacked and killed Meng.

sentences.zh: 猛為悼王。

translations.literal: Meng was King Dao.
translations.idiomatic: Meng was King Dao.

sentences.zh: 晉人攻子朝而立丐，是為敬王。

translations.literal: The Jin people attacked Zi Zhao and established Gai. He was King Jing.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people attacked Zi Zhao and established Gai. He was King Jing.

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, King Ling collapsed. His son King Jing Gui was established. In King Jing's eighteenth year, the queen's crown prince Sheng died early. In the twentieth year, King Jing loved his son Zhao and wished to establish him. He happened to collapse. Zi Gai's faction contended for the establishment. The state people established the eldest son Meng as king. Zi Zhao attacked and killed Meng. Meng was King Dao. The Jin people attacked Zi Zhao and established Gai. He was King Jing.

sentences.zh: 敬王元年，晉人入敬王，子朝自立，敬王不得入，居澤。

translations.literal: In King Jing's first year, the Jin people entered King Jing. Zi Zhao established himself. King Jing could not enter and resided at Ze.
translations.idiomatic: In King Jing's first year, the Jin people entered King Jing. Zi Zhao established himself. King Jing could not enter and resided at Ze.

sentences.zh: 四年，晉率諸侯入敬王于周，子朝為臣，諸侯城周。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Jin led the feudal lords to enter King Jing at Zhou. Zi Zhao became a minister. The feudal lords walled Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Jin led the lords to enter King Jing at Zhou. Zi Zhao became a minister. The lords walled Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十六年，子朝之徒復作亂，敬王奔于晉。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Zi Zhao's followers again made rebellion. King Jing fled to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Zi Zhao's followers again made rebellion. King Jing fled to Jin.

sentences.zh: 十七年，晉定公遂入敬王于周。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, Duke Ding of Jin then entered King Jing at Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Duke Ding of Jin then entered King Jing at Zhou.

translations.literal: In King Jing's first year, the Jin people entered King Jing. Zi Zhao established himself. King Jing could not enter and resided at Ze. In the fourth year, Jin led the feudal lords to enter King Jing at Zhou. Zi Zhao became a minister. The feudal lords walled Zhou. In the sixteenth year, Zi Zhao's followers again made rebellion. King Jing fled to Jin. In the seventeenth year, Duke Ding of Jin then entered King Jing at Zhou.

sentences.zh: 三十九年，齊田常殺其君簡公。

translations.literal: In the thirty-ninth year, Tian Chang of Qi killed their ruler Duke Jian.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-ninth year, Tian Chang of Qi killed their ruler Duke Jian.

translations.literal: In the thirty-ninth year, Tian Chang of Qi killed their ruler Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 四十一年，楚滅陳。

translations.literal: In the forty-first year, Chu extinguished Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-first year, Chu extinguished Chen.

sentences.zh: 孔子卒。

translations.literal: Confucius died.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius died.

translations.literal: In the forty-first year, Chu extinguished Chen. Confucius died.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，敬王崩，子元王仁立。

translations.literal: In the forty-second year, King Jing collapsed. His son King Yuan Ren was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, King Jing collapsed. His son King Yuan Ren was established.

sentences.zh: 元王八年，崩，子定王介立。

translations.literal: In King Yuan's eighth year, he collapsed. His son King Ding Jie was established.
translations.idiomatic: In King Yuan's eighth year, he collapsed. His son King Ding Jie was established.

translations.literal: In the forty-second year, King Jing collapsed. His son King Yuan Ren was established. In King Yuan's eighth year, he collapsed. His son King Ding Jie was established.

sentences.zh: 定王十六年，三晉滅智伯，分有其地。

translations.literal: In King Ding's sixteenth year, the three Jin states extinguished Zhi Bo and divided up his territory.
translations.idiomatic: In King Ding's sixteenth year, the three Jin states extinguished Zhi Bo and divided up his territory.

translations.literal: In King Ding's sixteenth year, the three Jin states extinguished Zhi Bo and divided up his territory.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，定王崩，長子去疾立，是為哀王。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, King Ding collapsed. His eldest son Qu Ji was established. He was King Ai.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, King Ding collapsed. His eldest son Qu Ji was established. He was King Ai.

sentences.zh: 哀王立三月，弟叔襲殺哀王而自立，是為思王。

translations.literal: King Ai was established for three months. His younger brother Shu attacked and killed King Ai, then established himself. He was King Si.
translations.idiomatic: King Ai was established for three months. His younger brother Shu attacked and killed King Ai, then established himself. He was King Si.

sentences.zh: 思王立五月，少弟嵬攻殺思王而自立，是為考王。

translations.literal: King Si was established for five months. His younger brother Wei attacked and killed King Si, then established himself. He was King Kao.
translations.idiomatic: King Si was established for five months. His younger brother Wei attacked and killed King Si, then established himself. He was King Kao.

sentences.zh: 此三王皆定王之子。

translations.literal: These three kings were all sons of King Ding.
translations.idiomatic: These three kings were all sons of King Ding.

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, King Ding collapsed. His eldest son Qu Ji was established. He was King Ai. King Ai was established for three months. His younger brother Shu attacked and killed King Ai, then established himself. He was King Si. King Si was established for five months. His younger brother Wei attacked and killed King Si, then established himself. He was King Kao. These three kings were all sons of King Ding.

sentences.zh: 考王十五年，崩，子威烈王午立。

translations.literal: In King Kao's fifteenth year, he collapsed. His son King Wei Lie Wu was established.
translations.idiomatic: In King Kao's fifteenth year, he collapsed. His son King Wei Lie Wu was established.

translations.literal: In King Kao's fifteenth year, he collapsed. His son King Wei Lie Wu was established.

sentences.zh: 考王封其弟于河南，是為桓公，以續周公之官職。

translations.literal: King Kao enfeoffed his younger brother at Henan. He was Duke Huan, to continue the Zhou Gong's official duties.
translations.idiomatic: King Kao enfeoffed his younger brother at Henan. He was Duke Huan, to continue the Zhou Gong's official duties.

sentences.zh: 桓公卒，子威公代立。

translations.literal: Duke Huan died. His son Duke Wei succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan died. His son Duke Wei succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 威公卒，子惠公代立，乃封其少子於鞏以奉王，號東周惠公。

translations.literal: Duke Wei died. His son Duke Hui succeeded him. He then enfeoffed his youngest son at Gong to serve the king, giving him the title East Zhou Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wei died. His son Duke Hui succeeded him. He then enfeoffed his youngest son at Gong to serve the king, giving him the title East Zhou Duke Hui.

translations.literal: King Kao enfeoffed his younger brother at Henan. He was Duke Huan, to continue the Zhou Gong's official duties. Duke Huan died. His son Duke Wei succeeded him. Duke Wei died. His son Duke Hui succeeded him. He then enfeoffed his youngest son at Gong to serve the king, giving him the title East Zhou Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 威烈王二十三年，九鼎震。

translations.literal: In King Wei Lie's twenty-third year, the nine tripods shook.
translations.idiomatic: In King Wei Lie's twenty-third year, the nine tripods shook.

sentences.zh: 命韓、魏、趙為諸侯。

translations.literal: He commanded Han, Wei, and Zhao to be feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: He commanded Han, Wei, and Zhao to be lords.

translations.literal: In King Wei Lie's twenty-third year, the nine tripods shook. He commanded Han, Wei, and Zhao to be feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，崩，子安王驕立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, he collapsed. His son King An Jiao was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, he collapsed. His son King An Jiao was established.

sentences.zh: 是歲盜殺楚聲王。

translations.literal: This year, bandits killed King Sheng of Chu.
translations.idiomatic: This year, bandits killed King Sheng of Chu.

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, he collapsed. His son King An Jiao was established. This year, bandits killed King Sheng of Chu.

sentences.zh: 安王立二十六年，崩，子烈王喜立。

translations.literal: King An was established for twenty-six years. He collapsed. His son King Lie Xi was established.
translations.idiomatic: King An was established for twenty-six years. He collapsed. His son King Lie Xi was established.

sentences.zh: 烈王二年，周太史儋見秦獻公曰：「始周與秦國合而別，別五百載復合，合十七歲而霸王者出焉。」

translations.literal: Lie Wang second year, Zhou grand historian Dan saw Qin Xian Gong said: 'Beginning Zhou with Qin state united then separated, separated five hundred years again united, united seventeen years and hegemon king emerges.'
translations.idiomatic: In King Lie's second year, Zhou's grand historian Dan saw Duke Xian of Qin and said: 'Originally Zhou and Qin were united then separated. Separated for five hundred years they reunite. United for seventeen years and a hegemon king will emerge.'

translations.literal: King An was established for twenty-six years. He collapsed. His son King Lie Xi was established. In King Lie's second year, Zhou's grand historian Dan saw Duke Xian of Qin and said: 'Originally Zhou and Qin were united then separated. Separated for five hundred years they reunite. United for seventeen years and a hegemon king will emerge.'

sentences.zh: 十年，烈王崩，弟扁立，是為顯王。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, King Lie collapsed. His younger brother Bian was established. He was King Xian.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, King Lie collapsed. His younger brother Bian was established. He was King Xian.

sentences.zh: 顯王五年，賀秦獻公，獻公稱伯。

translations.literal: In King Xian's fifth year, he congratulated Duke Xian of Qin. Duke Xian called himself Bo.
translations.idiomatic: In King Xian's fifth year, he congratulated Duke Xian of Qin. Duke Xian called himself Bo.

sentences.zh: 九年，致文武胙於秦孝公。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, he presented the Wen and Wu sacrifices to Duke Xiao of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, he presented the Wen and Wu sacrifices to Duke Xiao of Qin.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，秦會諸侯於周。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Qin assembled the feudal lords at Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Qin assembled the lords at Zhou.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，周致伯於秦孝公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Zhou presented the title of Bo to Duke Xiao of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Zhou presented the title of Bo to Duke Xiao of Qin.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，賀秦惠王。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, he congratulated King Hui of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, he congratulated King Hui of Qin.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，致文武胙於秦惠王。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, he presented the Wen and Wu sacrifices to King Hui of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, he presented the Wen and Wu sacrifices to King Hui of Qin.

sentences.zh: 四十四年，秦惠王稱王。

translations.literal: In the forty-fourth year, King Hui of Qin called himself king.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-fourth year, King Hui of Qin called himself king.

sentences.zh: 其後諸侯皆為王。

translations.literal: Afterwards, all the feudal lords became kings.
translations.idiomatic: Afterwards, all the feudal feudal lords became kings.

translations.literal: In the tenth year, King Lie collapsed. His younger brother Bian was established. He was King Xian. In King Xian's fifth year, he congratulated Duke Xian of Qin. Duke Xian called himself Bo. In the ninth year, he presented the Wen and Wu sacrifices to Duke Xiao of Qin. In the twenty-fifth year, Qin assembled the feudal lords at Zhou. In the twenty-sixth year, Zhou presented the title of Bo to Duke Xiao of Qin. In the thirty-third year, he congratulated King Hui of Qin. In the thirty-fifth year, he presented the Wen and Wu sacrifices to King Hui of Qin. In the forty-fourth year, King Hui of Qin called himself king. Afterwards, all the feudal lords became kings.

sentences.zh: 四十八年，顯王崩，子慎靚王定立。

translations.literal: In the forty-eighth year, King Xian collapsed. His son King Shen Jing Ding was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-eighth year, King Xian collapsed. His son King Shen Jing Ding ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 慎靚王立六年，崩，子赧王延立。

translations.literal: King Shen Jing was established for six years. He collapsed. His son King Nan Yan was established.
translations.idiomatic: King Shen Jing ascended the throne for six years. He collapsed. His son King Nan Yan ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 王赧時東西周分治。

translations.literal: In King Nan's time, east and west Zhou were governed separately.
translations.idiomatic: In King Nan's time, east and west Zhou were governed separately.

sentences.zh: 王赧徙都西周。

translations.literal: King Nan moved his capital to West Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: King Nan moved his capital to West Zhou.

translations.literal: In the forty-eighth year, King Xian collapsed. His son King Shen Jing Ding was established. King Shen Jing was established for six years. He collapsed. His son King Nan Yan was established. In King Nan's time, east and west Zhou were governed separately. King Nan moved his capital to West Zhou.

sentences.zh: 西周武公之共太子死，有五庶子，毋適立。

translations.literal: West Zhou Duke Wu's crown prince died. He had five concubine sons. No proper heir was established.
translations.idiomatic: West Zhou Lord Wu's crown prince passed away. He had five concubine sons. No proper heir ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 司馬翦謂楚王曰：「不如以地資公子咎，為請太子。」

translations.literal: Si Ma Jian told Chu Wang said: 'Not as good with land aid Gong Zi Jiu, petition crown prince.'
translations.idiomatic: Si Ma Jian told the Chu king and said: 'Better to aid Gong Zi Jiu with land and petition for him to be crown prince.'

sentences.zh: 左成曰：「不可。

translations.literal: Zuo Cheng said: 'Cannot.
translations.idiomatic: Zuo Cheng said: 'Cannot.

sentences.zh: 周不聽，是公之知困而交疏於周也。

translations.literal: Zhou will not listen. This is the duke's wisdom in distress and relations distant with Zhou as well.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou will not listen. This is the duke's wisdom in distress and relations distant with Zhou as well.

sentences.zh: 不如請周君孰欲立，以微告翦，翦請令楚（賀）［資］之以地。」

translations.literal: Not as good ask Zhou ruler who wishes establish, with subtle tell Jian, Jian petition make Chu provide with land.'
translations.idiomatic: Better to ask the Zhou ruler who he wishes to establish, subtly tell Jian, and Jian will petition to have Chu provide him with land.'

sentences.zh: 果立公子咎為太子。

translations.literal: Indeed Gong Zi Jiu was established as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed Gong Zi Jiu ascended the throne as crown prince.

translations.literal: West Zhou Duke Wu's crown prince died. He had five concubine sons. No proper heir was established. Si Ma Jian told the Chu king and said: 'Better to aid Gong Zi Jiu with land and petition for him to be crown prince.' Zuo Cheng said: 'Cannot. Zhou will not listen. This is the duke's wisdom in distress and relations distant with Zhou as well. Better to ask the Zhou ruler who he wishes to establish, subtly tell Jian, and Jian will petition to have Chu provide him with land.' Indeed Gong Zi Jiu was established as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 八年，秦攻宜陽，楚救之。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Qin attacked Yiyang. Chu rescued it.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Qin attacked Yiyang. Chu rescued it.

sentences.zh: 而楚以周為秦故，將伐之。

translations.literal: But Chu, because Zhou was on Qin's side, would attack it.
translations.idiomatic: But Chu, because Zhou was on Qin's side, would attack it.

sentences.zh: 蘇代為周說楚王曰：「何以周為秦之禍也？

translations.literal: Su Dai for Zhou persuaded Chu Wang said: 'Why take Zhou as Qin disaster?
translations.idiomatic: Su Dai persuaded the Chu king for Zhou and said: 'Why consider Zhou to be Qin's disaster?

sentences.zh: 言周之為秦甚於楚者，欲令周入秦也，故謂『周秦』也。

translations.literal: Said Zhou to Qin more than Chu, wished make Zhou enter Qin, therefore called 'Zhou Qin'.
translations.idiomatic: They say Zhou is more valuable to Qin than to Chu. They wish to make Zhou enter Qin, so they call it 'Zhou Qin'.

sentences.zh: 周知其不可解，必入於秦，此為秦取周之精者也。

translations.literal: Zhou knew the alliance could not be broken. It would certainly enter Qin. This was the way for Qin to take Zhou's essence.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou knew the alliance could not be broken. It would certainly enter Qin. This was the way for Qin to take Zhou's essence.

sentences.zh: 為王計者，周於秦因善之，不於秦亦言善之，以疏之於秦。

translations.literal: For your majesty's plan: If Zhou is at Qin, then favor it. If not at Qin, also speak of favoring it, to distance it from Qin.
translations.idiomatic: For your majesty's plan: If Zhou is at Qin, then favor it. If not at Qin, also speak of favoring it, to distance it from Qin.

sentences.zh: 周絕於秦，必入於郢矣。」

translations.literal: Zhou cut off from Qin, certainly entered Ying.'
translations.idiomatic: If Zhou is cut off from Qin, it will certainly enter Ying.'

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Qin attacked Yiyang. Chu rescued it. But Chu, because Zhou was on Qin's side, would attack it. Su Dai persuaded the Chu king for Zhou and said: 'Why consider Zhou to be Qin's disaster? They say Zhou is more valuable to Qin than to Chu. They wish to make Zhou enter Qin, so they call it 'Zhou Qin'. Zhou knew the alliance could not be broken. It would certainly enter Qin. This was the way for Qin to take Zhou's essence. For your majesty's plan: If Zhou is at Qin, then favor it. If not at Qin, also speak of favoring it, to distance it from Qin. If Zhou is cut off from Qin, it will certainly enter Ying.'

sentences.zh: 秦借道兩周之閒，將以伐韓，周恐借之畏於韓，不借畏於秦。

translations.literal: Qin borrowed a road between the two Zhou states. It would use it to attack Han. Zhou feared borrowing would offend Han, but not borrowing would offend Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Qin borrowed a road between the two Zhou states. It would use it to attack Han. Zhou feared borrowing would offend Han, but not borrowing would offend Qin.

sentences.zh: 史厭謂周君曰：「何不令人謂韓公叔曰『秦之敢絕周而伐韓者，信東周也。

translations.literal: Shi Yan told Zhou ruler said: 'Why not make person tell Han Gong Shu said 'Qin dares cut off Zhou and attack Han, trusts East Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Yan told the Zhou ruler and said: 'Why not have someone tell Han Gong Shu that Qin dares to cut off Zhou and attack Han because it trusts East Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 公何不與周地，發質使之楚』？

translations.literal: Duke why not give Zhou land, send hostage make go to Chu'?
translations.idiomatic: Why doesn't the duke give Zhou land and send a hostage to make it go to Chu?'

sentences.zh: 秦必疑楚不信周，是韓不伐也。

translations.literal: Qin will certainly doubt Chu and not trust Zhou. This means Han will not be attacked.
translations.idiomatic: Qin will certainly doubt Chu and not trust Zhou. This means Han will not be attacked.

sentences.zh: 又謂秦曰『韓彊與周地，將以疑周於秦也，周不敢不受』。

translations.literal: Again tell Qin said 'Han strong gave Zhou land, would use to doubt Zhou at Qin, Zhou dare not not receive'.
translations.idiomatic: Also tell Qin that 'Han is strong and gave Zhou land. It would use this to make Qin doubt Zhou. Zhou would not dare not to receive it.'

sentences.zh: 秦必無辭而令周不受，是受地於韓而聽於秦。」

translations.literal: Qin certainly no excuse and make Zhou not receive, this receive land from Han and listen to Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: Qin will certainly have no excuse and make Zhou not receive it. This means receiving land from Han while listening to Qin.'

translations.literal: Qin borrowed a road between the two Zhou states. It would use it to attack Han. Zhou feared borrowing would offend Han, but not borrowing would offend Qin. Shi Yan told the Zhou ruler and said: 'Why not have someone tell Han Gong Shu that Qin dares to cut off Zhou and attack Han because it trusts East Zhou.' Why doesn't the duke give Zhou land and send a hostage to make it go to Chu?' Qin will certainly doubt Chu and not trust Zhou. This means Han will not be attacked. Also tell Qin that 'Han is strong and gave Zhou land. It would use this to make Qin doubt Zhou. Zhou would not dare not to receive it.' Qin will certainly have no excuse and make Zhou not receive it. This means receiving land from Han while listening to Qin.'

sentences.zh: 秦召西周君，西周君惡往，故令人謂韓王曰：「秦召西周君，將以使攻王之南陽也，王何不出兵於南陽？

translations.literal: Qin summoned West Zhou ruler, West Zhou ruler hated to go, therefore made person tell Han Wang said: 'Qin summoned West Zhou ruler, will use to make attack king South Yang, king why not send troops to South Yang?
translations.idiomatic: Qin summoned the West Zhou ruler. The West Zhou ruler hated to go, so he had someone tell the Han king: 'Qin has summoned the West Zhou ruler. It will use him to attack your South Yang. Why doesn't your majesty send troops to South Yang?

sentences.zh: 周君將以為辭於秦。

translations.literal: The Zhou ruler would use this as an excuse with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou ruler would use this as an excuse with Qin.

sentences.zh: 周君不入秦，秦必不敢踰河而攻南陽矣。」

translations.literal: Zhou ruler not enter Qin, Qin certainly dare not cross river and attack South Yang.'
translations.idiomatic: If the Zhou ruler does not enter Qin, Qin will certainly not dare cross the river and attack South Yang.'

translations.literal: Qin summoned the West Zhou ruler. The West Zhou ruler hated to go, so he had someone tell the Han king: 'Qin has summoned the West Zhou ruler. It will use him to attack your South Yang. Why doesn't your majesty send troops to South Yang? The Zhou ruler would use this as an excuse with Qin. If the Zhou ruler does not enter Qin, Qin will certainly not dare cross the river and attack South Yang.'

sentences.zh: 東周與西周戰，韓救西周。

translations.literal: East Zhou fought with West Zhou. Han rescued West Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: East Zhou fought with West Zhou. Han rescued West Zhou.

sentences.zh: 或為東周說韓王曰：「西周故天子之國，多名器重寶。

translations.literal: Someone for East Zhou persuaded Han Wang said: 'West Zhou formerly Son of Heaven country, many famous vessels heavy treasures.
translations.idiomatic: Someone persuaded the Han king for East Zhou and said: 'West Zhou was formerly the Son of Heaven's country. It has many famous vessels and heavy treasures.

sentences.zh: 王案兵毋出，可以德東周，而西周之寶必可以盡矣。」

translations.literal: King hold troops not send out, can favor East Zhou, but West Zhou treasures certainly can exhaust.'
translations.idiomatic: If your majesty holds his troops and does not send them out, he can favor East Zhou, and West Zhou's treasures will certainly be exhausted.'

translations.literal: East Zhou fought with West Zhou. Han rescued West Zhou. Someone persuaded the Han king for East Zhou and said: 'West Zhou was formerly the Son of Heaven's country. It has many famous vessels and heavy treasures. If your majesty holds his troops and does not send them out, he can favor East Zhou, and West Zhou's treasures will certainly be exhausted.'

sentences.zh: 王赧謂成君。

translations.literal: King Nan called Cheng Jun.
translations.idiomatic: King Nan called Cheng Jun.

sentences.zh: 楚圍雍氏，韓徵甲與粟於東周，東周君恐，召蘇代而告之。

translations.literal: Chu surrounded Yongshi. Han demanded armor and grain from East Zhou. The East Zhou ruler feared this, summoned Su Dai and told him.
translations.idiomatic: Chu surrounded Yongshi. Han demanded armor and grain from East Zhou. The East Zhou ruler feared this, summoned Su Dai and told him.

sentences.zh: 代曰：「君何患於是。

translations.literal: Dai said: 'Ruler why worry about this.
translations.idiomatic: Dai said: 'Why does my lord worry about this?

sentences.zh: 臣能使韓毋徵甲與粟於周，又能為君得高都。」

translations.literal: Minister can make Han not demand armor and grain from Zhou, also can for ruler get Gao Du.'
translations.idiomatic: Your minister can make Han not demand armor and grain from Zhou, and can also get Gaodu for my lord.'

sentences.zh: 周君曰：「子茍能，請以國聽子。」

translations.literal: Zhou ruler said: 'You if can, please with state listen to you.'
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou ruler said: 'If you can do this, I will listen to you regarding the state.'

sentences.zh: 代見韓相國曰：「楚圍雍氏，期三月也，今五月不能拔，是楚病也。

translations.literal: Dai saw Han prime minister said: 'Chu surrounds Yong Shi, period three months, now five months cannot take, this Chu illness.
translations.idiomatic: Dai saw the Han prime minister and said: 'Chu surrounds Yongshi. The period was three months, but now five months and it cannot be taken. This is Chu's weakness.

sentences.zh: 今相國乃徵甲與粟於周，是告楚病也。」

translations.literal: Now prime minister then demands armor and grain from Zhou, this tells Chu weakness.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the prime minister demands armor and grain from Zhou. This tells Chu of our weakness.'

sentences.zh: 韓相國曰：「善。

translations.literal: Han prime minister said: 'Good.
translations.idiomatic: The Han prime minister said: 'Good.

sentences.zh: 使者已行矣。」

translations.literal: Messenger already gone.'
translations.idiomatic: The messenger has already gone.'

sentences.zh: 代曰：「何不與周高都？」

translations.literal: Dai said: 'Why not give Zhou Gao Du?'
translations.idiomatic: Dai said: 'Why not give Zhou Gaodu?'

sentences.zh: 韓相國大怒曰：「吾毋徵甲與粟於周亦已多矣，何故與周高都也？」

translations.literal: Han prime minister greatly angry said: 'I not demand armor and grain from Zhou already much, why give Zhou Gao Du?'
translations.idiomatic: The Han prime minister was greatly angry and said: 'I am already not demanding armor and grain from Zhou—that is already too much. Why give Zhou Gaodu?'

sentences.zh: 代曰：「與周高都，是周折而入於韓也，秦聞之必大怒忿周，即不通周使，是以獘高都得完周也。

translations.literal: Dai said: 'Give Zhou Gao Du, this Zhou bends and enters Han, Qin hears certainly greatly angry resents Zhou, then cuts off Zhou envoys, this with crippled Gao Du gets complete Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Dai said: 'Giving Zhou Gaodu means Zhou bends and enters Han. Qin will hear of it and certainly be greatly angry, resent Zhou, and cut off Zhou's envoys. This way, with crippled Gaodu we get a complete Zhou.

sentences.zh: 曷為不與？」

translations.literal: Why not give?'
translations.idiomatic: Why not give it?'

sentences.zh: 相國曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Prime minister said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: The prime minister said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 果與周高都。

translations.literal: Indeed gave Zhou Gaodu.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed gave Zhou Gaodu.

translations.literal: King Nan called Cheng Jun. Chu surrounded Yongshi. Han demanded armor and grain from East Zhou. The East Zhou ruler feared this, summoned Su Dai and told him. Dai said: 'Why does my lord worry about this? Your minister can make Han not demand armor and grain from Zhou, and can also get Gaodu for my lord.' The Zhou ruler said: 'If you can do this, I will listen to you regarding the state.' Dai saw the Han prime minister and said: 'Chu surrounds Yongshi. The period was three months, but now five months and it cannot be taken. This is Chu's weakness. Now the prime minister demands armor and grain from Zhou. This tells Chu of our weakness.' The Han prime minister said: 'Good. The messenger has already gone.' Dai said: 'Why not give Zhou Gaodu?' The Han prime minister was greatly angry and said: 'I am already not demanding armor and grain from Zhou—that is already too much. Why give Zhou Gaodu?' Dai said: 'Giving Zhou Gaodu means Zhou bends and enters Han. Qin will hear of it and certainly be greatly angry, resent Zhou, and cut off Zhou's envoys. This way, with crippled Gaodu we get a complete Zhou. Why not give it?' The prime minister said: 'Good.' Indeed gave Zhou Gaodu.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，蘇厲謂周君曰：「秦破韓、魏，撲師武，北取趙藺、離石者，皆白起也。

translations.literal: Thirty-fourth year, Su Li told Zhou ruler said: 'Qin broke Han, Wei, defeated Shi Wu, north took Zhao Lin, Li Shi, all Bai Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, Su Li told the Zhou ruler and said: 'Qin broke Han and Wei, defeated Shi Wu, took Lin and Lishi from Zhao in the north—all this was Bai Qi.'

sentences.zh: 是善用兵，又有天命。

translations.literal: He is good at using troops and also has the mandate of heaven.
translations.idiomatic: He is good at using troops and also has the mandate of heaven.

sentences.zh: 今又將兵出塞攻梁，梁破則周危矣。

translations.literal: Now he will again lead troops out the border to attack Liang. If Liang is broken, then Zhou will be in danger.
translations.idiomatic: Now he will again lead troops out the border to attack Liang. If Liang is broken, then Zhou will be in danger.

sentences.zh: 君何不令人說白起乎？

translations.literal: Ruler why not make person persuade Bai Qi?
translations.idiomatic: Why doesn't my lord have someone persuade Bai Qi?

sentences.zh: 曰『楚有養由基者，善射者也。

translations.literal: Said 'Chu has Yang You Ji, good archer.
translations.idiomatic: Say 'Chu has Yang Youji, who is a good archer.

sentences.zh: 去柳葉百步而射之，百發而百中之。

translations.literal: He shoots willow leaves from a hundred paces, a hundred shots a hundred hits.
translations.idiomatic: He shoots willow leaves from a hundred paces, a hundred shots a hundred hits.

sentences.zh: 左右觀者數千人，皆曰善射。

translations.literal: The observers on left and right, several thousand people, all said he was good at shooting.
translations.idiomatic: The observers on left and right, several thousand people, all said he was good at shooting.

sentences.zh: 有一夫立其旁，曰「善，可教射矣」。

translations.literal: Had one man stood his side, said 'Good, can teach shooting.'
translations.idiomatic: One man stood by his side and said 'Good, he can be taught shooting.'

sentences.zh: 養由基怒，釋弓搤劍，曰「客安能教我射乎」？

translations.literal: Yang You Ji angry, released bow grasped sword, said 'Guest how can teach me shooting?'
translations.idiomatic: Yang Youji was angry. He released his bow and grasped his sword, saying 'How can a guest teach me shooting?'

sentences.zh: 客曰「非吾能教子支左詘右也。

translations.literal: Guest said 'Not I can teach you support left bend right.
translations.idiomatic: The guest said 'I cannot teach you to support left and bend right.

sentences.zh: 夫去柳葉百步而射之，百發而百中之，不以善息，少焉氣衰力倦，弓撥矢鉤，一發不中者，百發盡息」。

translations.literal: Indeed from willow leaf hundred paces shoot it, hundred shots hundred hits, not with good rest, little time qi decline strength tired, bow crooked arrow hooked, one shot not hit, hundred shots all rest.'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, shooting willow leaves from a hundred paces, a hundred shots a hundred hits, without resting on the good, in a little time qi declines and strength tires, bow becomes crooked and arrow hooked, one shot misses and a hundred shots all come to rest.'

sentences.zh: 今破韓、魏，撲師武，北取趙藺、離石者，公之功多矣。

translations.literal: Now breaking Han and Wei, defeating Shi Wu, taking Lin and Lishi from Zhao in the north—your merit is much already.
translations.idiomatic: Now breaking Han and Wei, defeating Shi Wu, taking Lin and Lishi from Zhao in the north—your merit is much already.

sentences.zh: 今又將兵出塞，過兩周，倍韓，攻梁，一舉不得，前功盡棄。

translations.literal: Now you will again lead troops out the border, pass the two Zhou, double back on Han, attack Liang. If one move doesn't succeed, all previous merit will be abandoned.
translations.idiomatic: Now you will again lead troops out the border, pass the two Zhou, double back on Han, attack Liang. If one move doesn't succeed, all previous merit will be abandoned.

sentences.zh: 公不如稱病而無出』。」

translations.literal: Duke not as good claim illness and not go out.'
translations.idiomatic: You would be better to claim illness and not go out.'

translations.literal: In the thirty-fourth year, Su Li told the Zhou ruler and said: 'Qin broke Han and Wei, defeated Shi Wu, took Lin and Lishi from Zhao in the north—all this was Bai Qi.' He is good at using troops and also has the mandate of heaven. Now he will again lead troops out the border to attack Liang. If Liang is broken, then Zhou will be in danger. Why doesn't my lord have someone persuade Bai Qi? Say 'Chu has Yang Youji, who is a good archer. He shoots willow leaves from a hundred paces, a hundred shots a hundred hits. The observers on left and right, several thousand people, all said he was good at shooting. One man stood by his side and said 'Good, he can be taught shooting.' Yang Youji was angry. He released his bow and grasped his sword, saying 'How can a guest teach me shooting?' The guest said 'I cannot teach you to support left and bend right. Indeed, shooting willow leaves from a hundred paces, a hundred shots a hundred hits, without resting on the good, in a little time qi declines and strength tires, bow becomes crooked and arrow hooked, one shot misses and a hundred shots all come to rest.' Now breaking Han and Wei, defeating Shi Wu, taking Lin and Lishi from Zhao in the north—your merit is much already. Now you will again lead troops out the border, pass the two Zhou, double back on Han, attack Liang. If one move doesn't succeed, all previous merit will be abandoned. You would be better to claim illness and not go out.'

sentences.zh: 四十二年，秦破華陽約。

translations.literal: In the forty-second year, Qin broke the Huayang alliance.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, Qin broke the Huayang alliance.

sentences.zh: 馬犯謂周君曰：「請令梁城周。」

translations.literal: Ma Fan told Zhou ruler said: 'Please make Liang wall Zhou.'
translations.idiomatic: Ma Fan told the Zhou ruler and said: 'Please have Liang wall Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 乃謂梁王曰：「周王病若死，則犯必死矣。

translations.literal: Then told Liang Wang said: 'Zhou Wang illness if die, then Fan certainly die.
translations.idiomatic: Then he told the Liang king and said: 'If the Zhou king dies from illness, then Fan will certainly die.

sentences.zh: 犯請以九鼎自入於王，王受九鼎而圖犯。」

translations.literal: Fan requests with nine tripods self enter to king, king receive nine tripods and plot against Fan.'
translations.idiomatic: Fan requests to personally bring the nine tripods to the king. The king receives the nine tripods and plots against Fan.'

sentences.zh: 梁王曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Liang Wang said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: The Liang king said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 遂與之卒，言戍周。

translations.literal: Then gave him troops, saying they would garrison Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Then gave him troops, saying they would garrison Zhou.

sentences.zh: 因謂秦王曰：「梁非戍周也，將伐周也。

translations.literal: Then told Qin Wang said: 'Liang not garrison Zhou, will attack Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Then he told the Qin king and said: 'Liang is not garrisoning Zhou. It will attack Zhou.

sentences.zh: 王試出兵境以觀之。」

translations.literal: King try send troops border to observe it.'
translations.idiomatic: Your majesty, try sending troops to the border to observe it.'

sentences.zh: 秦果出兵。

translations.literal: Qin indeed sent troops.
translations.idiomatic: Qin indeed sent troops.

sentences.zh: 又謂梁王曰：「周王病甚矣，犯請後可而復之。

translations.literal: Again told Liang Wang said: 'Zhou Wang illness severe, Fan requests later suitable and return it.
translations.idiomatic: Again he told the Liang king and said: 'The Zhou king's illness is severe. Fan requests to return it when it is later suitable.

sentences.zh: 今王使卒之周，諸侯皆生心，後舉事且不信。

translations.literal: Now the king sends troops to Zhou. All the feudal lords will have thoughts. Later when raising affairs, it will moreover not be trusted.
translations.idiomatic: Now the king sends troops to Zhou. All the feudal feudal lords will have thoughts. Later when raising affairs, it will moreover not be trusted.

sentences.zh: 不若令卒為周城，以匿事端。」

translations.literal: Not as good make troops wall Zhou, to hide affairs beginning.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to have the troops wall Zhou, to hide the beginning of affairs.'

sentences.zh: 梁王曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Liang Wang said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: The Liang king said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 遂使城周。

translations.literal: Then had them wall Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Then had them wall Zhou.

translations.literal: In the forty-second year, Qin broke the Huayang alliance. Ma Fan told the Zhou ruler and said: 'Please have Liang wall Zhou.' Then he told the Liang king and said: 'If the Zhou king dies from illness, then Fan will certainly die. Fan requests to personally bring the nine tripods to the king. The king receives the nine tripods and plots against Fan.' The Liang king said: 'Good.' Then gave him troops, saying they would garrison Zhou. Then he told the Qin king and said: 'Liang is not garrisoning Zhou. It will attack Zhou. Your majesty, try sending troops to the border to observe it.' Qin indeed sent troops. Again he told the Liang king and said: 'The Zhou king's illness is severe. Fan requests to return it when it is later suitable. Now the king sends troops to Zhou. All the feudal lords will have thoughts. Later when raising affairs, it will moreover not be trusted. It would be better to have the troops wall Zhou, to hide the beginning of affairs.' The Liang king said: 'Good.' Then had them wall Zhou.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，周君之秦客謂周（最）［聚］曰：「公不若譽秦王之孝，因以應為太后養地，秦王必喜，是公有秦交。

translations.literal: Forty-fifth year, Zhou ruler Qin guest told Zhou Ju said: 'Duke not as good praise Qin Wang filial piety, because with Ying for empress dowager support land, Qin Wang certainly happy, this duke has Qin relations.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-fifth year, the Zhou ruler's Qin guest told Zhou Ju and said: 'You would be better to praise the Qin king's filial piety, and because of this give Ying as land to support the empress dowager. The Qin king will certainly be happy. This way you have Qin relations.

sentences.zh: 交善，周君必以為公功。

translations.literal: If relations are good, the Zhou ruler will certainly take it as your merit.
translations.idiomatic: If relations are good, the Zhou ruler will certainly take it as your merit.

sentences.zh: 交惡，勸周君入秦者必有罪矣。」

translations.literal: Relations bad, advise Zhou ruler enter Qin certainly have crime.'
translations.idiomatic: If relations are bad, those who advise the Zhou ruler to enter Qin will certainly have crime.'

sentences.zh: 秦攻周，而周聚謂秦王曰：「為王計者不攻周。

translations.literal: Qin attacked Zhou, but Zhou Ju told Qin Wang said: 'For king plan not attack Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Qin attacked Zhou, but Zhou Ju told the Qin king and said: 'For your majesty's plan, do not attack Zhou.

sentences.zh: 攻周，實不足以利，聲畏天下。

translations.literal: Attacking Zhou is not sufficient substance to profit, but reputation fears the world.
translations.idiomatic: Attacking Zhou is not sufficient substance to profit, but reputation fears the world.

sentences.zh: 天下以聲畏秦，必東合於齊。

translations.literal: The world, fearing Qin because of reputation, will certainly unite east at Qi.
translations.idiomatic: The world, fearing Qin because of reputation, will certainly unite east at Qi.

sentences.zh: 兵獘於周。

translations.literal: Troops will be crippled at Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Troops will be crippled at Zhou.

sentences.zh: 合天下於齊，則秦不王矣。

translations.literal: Uniting the world at Qi, then Qin will not become king.
translations.idiomatic: Uniting the world at Qi, then Qin will not become king.

sentences.zh: 天下欲獘秦，勸王攻周。

translations.literal: The world wishes to cripple Qin, so they advise the king to attack Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: The world wishes to cripple Qin, so they advise the king to attack Zhou.

sentences.zh: 秦與天下獘，則令不行矣。」

translations.literal: Qin with world crippled, then commands not carried out.'
translations.idiomatic: If Qin is crippled with the world, then commands will not be carried out.'

translations.literal: In the forty-fifth year, the Zhou ruler's Qin guest told Zhou Ju and said: 'You would be better to praise the Qin king's filial piety, and because of this give Ying as land to support the empress dowager. The Qin king will certainly be happy. This way you have Qin relations. If relations are good, the Zhou ruler will certainly take it as your merit. If relations are bad, those who advise the Zhou ruler to enter Qin will certainly have crime.' Qin attacked Zhou, but Zhou Ju told the Qin king and said: 'For your majesty's plan, do not attack Zhou. Attacking Zhou is not sufficient substance to profit, but reputation fears the world. The world, fearing Qin because of reputation, will certainly unite east at Qi. Troops will be crippled at Zhou. Uniting the world at Qi, then Qin will not become king. The world wishes to cripple Qin, so they advise the king to attack Zhou. If Qin is crippled with the world, then commands will not be carried out.'

sentences.zh: 五十八年，三晉距秦。

translations.literal: In the fifty-eighth year, the three Jin states resisted Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-eighth year, the three Jin states resisted Qin.

sentences.zh: 周令其相國之秦，以秦之輕也，還其行。

translations.literal: Zhou ordered their prime minister to Qin. Because Qin was light, they returned his journey.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou ordered their prime minister to Qin. Because Qin was light, they returned his journey.

sentences.zh: 客謂相國曰：「秦之輕重未可知也。

translations.literal: Guest told prime minister said: 'Qin light heavy not yet know.
translations.idiomatic: The guest told the prime minister and said: 'Whether Qin is light or heavy is not yet known.

sentences.zh: 秦欲知三國之情。

translations.literal: Qin wishes to know the three states' situation.
translations.idiomatic: Qin wishes to know the three states' situation.

sentences.zh: 公不如急見秦王曰『請為王聽東方之變』，秦王必重公。

translations.literal: Duke not as good quickly see Qin Wang said 'Please for king listen eastern changes', Qin Wang certainly heavy duke.
translations.idiomatic: You would be better to quickly see the Qin king and say 'Please let me listen to the eastern changes for the king.' The Qin king will certainly value you.

sentences.zh: 重公，是秦重周，周以取秦也；

translations.literal: Value duke, this Qin values Zhou, Zhou thereby takes Qin;
translations.idiomatic: Valuing you means Qin values Zhou. Zhou thereby takes Qin;

sentences.zh: 齊重，則固有周聚以收齊：是周常不失重國之交也。」

translations.literal: Qi values, then originally have Zhou Ju to receive Qi: this Zhou constantly not lose heavy state relations.'
translations.idiomatic: If Qi values, then originally Zhou Ju can receive Qi: this way Zhou constantly does not lose relations with heavy states.'

sentences.zh: 秦信周，發兵攻三晉。

translations.literal: Qin trusted Zhou and sent troops to attack the three Jin states.
translations.idiomatic: Qin trusted Zhou and sent troops to attack the three Jin states.

translations.literal: In the fifty-eighth year, the three Jin states resisted Qin. Zhou ordered their prime minister to Qin. Because Qin was light, they returned his journey. The guest told the prime minister and said: 'Whether Qin is light or heavy is not yet known. Qin wishes to know the three states' situation. You would be better to quickly see the Qin king and say 'Please let me listen to the eastern changes for the king.' The Qin king will certainly value you. Valuing you means Qin values Zhou. Zhou thereby takes Qin; If Qi values, then originally Zhou Ju can receive Qi: this way Zhou constantly does not lose relations with heavy states.' Qin trusted Zhou and sent troops to attack the three Jin states.

sentences.zh: 五十九年，秦取韓陽城負黍，西周恐，倍秦，與諸侯約從，將天下銳師出伊闕攻秦，令秦無得通陽城。

translations.literal: In the fifty-ninth year, Qin took Han's Yangcheng and Fushu. West Zhou feared, betrayed Qin, allied horizontally with the feudal lords, led the world's sharp troops out of Yique to attack Qin, making Qin unable to connect to Yangcheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-ninth year, Qin took Han's Yangcheng and Fushu. West Zhou feared, betrayed Qin, allied horizontally with the feudal feudal lords, led the world's sharp troops out of Yique to attack Qin, making Qin unable to connect to Yangcheng.

sentences.zh: 秦昭王怒，使將軍摎攻西周。

translations.literal: King Zhao of Qin was angry and sent General Liu to attack West Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao of Qin was angry and sent General Liu to attack West Zhou.

sentences.zh: 西周君犇秦，頓首受罪，盡獻其邑三十六，口三萬。

translations.literal: The West Zhou ruler fled to Qin, kowtowed and accepted his crime, completely offering his thirty-six cities and thirty thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: The West Zhou ruler fled to Qin, kowtowed and accepted his crime, completely offering his thirty-six cities and thirty thousand people.

sentences.zh: 秦受其獻，歸其君於周。

translations.literal: Qin accepted his offering and returned his ruler to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Qin accepted his offering and returned his ruler to Zhou.

translations.literal: In the fifty-ninth year, Qin took Han's Yangcheng and Fushu. West Zhou feared, betrayed Qin, allied horizontally with the feudal lords, led the world's sharp troops out of Yique to attack Qin, making Qin unable to connect to Yangcheng. King Zhao of Qin was angry and sent General Liu to attack West Zhou. The West Zhou ruler fled to Qin, kowtowed and accepted his crime, completely offering his thirty-six cities and thirty thousand people. Qin accepted his offering and returned his ruler to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周君、王赧卒，周民遂東亡。

translations.literal: The Zhou ruler King Nan died. The Zhou people then fled east.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou ruler King Nan passed away. The Zhou people then fled east.

sentences.zh: 秦取九鼎寶器，而遷西周公於憚狐。

translations.literal: Qin took the nine tripods and precious vessels, and moved the West Zhou Gong to Danhu.
translations.idiomatic: Qin took the nine tripods and precious vessels, and moved the West Zhou Gong to Danhu.

sentences.zh: 後七歲，秦莊襄王滅東（西）周。

translations.literal: After seven years, King Zhuang Xiang of Qin extinguished East Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: After seven years, King Zhuang Xiang of Qin extinguished East Zhou.

sentences.zh: 東西周皆入于秦，周既不祀。

translations.literal: Both east and west Zhou entered Qin. Zhou then ceased to sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Both Eastern Zhou and Western Zhou fell to Qin. The Zhou sacrifices ceased.

translations.literal: The Zhou ruler King Nan died. The Zhou people then fled east. Qin took the nine tripods and precious vessels, and moved the West Zhou Gong to Danhu. After seven years, King Zhuang Xiang of Qin extinguished East Zhou. Both east and west Zhou entered Qin. Zhou then ceased to sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：學者皆稱周伐紂，居洛邑，綜其實不然。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: scholars all say Zhou attacked Zhou, resided Luo city, comprehensively actually not so.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Scholars all say Zhou attacked Zhou and resided in Luoyi, but comprehensively this is actually not so.

sentences.zh: 武王營之，成王使召公卜居，居九鼎焉，而周復都豐、鎬。

translations.literal: King Wu planned it. King Cheng had the Duke of Shao divine the residence and placed the nine tripods there. But Zhou again made its capital Feng and Hao.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu planned it. King Cheng had the Duke of Shao divine the site and placed the nine tripods there. But Zhou once again made its capital at Feng and Hao.

sentences.zh: 至犬戎敗幽王，周乃東徙于洛邑。

translations.literal: Until the Quanrong defeated King You, Zhou then moved east to Luoyi.
translations.idiomatic: Until the Quanrong defeated King You, the Zhou then moved their capital east to Luoyi.

sentences.zh: 所謂「周公葬（我）［於］畢」，畢在鎬東南杜中。

translations.literal: What called 'Zhou Gong buried at Bi', Bi in Hao southeast Du middle.
translations.idiomatic: What is called 'the Duke of Zhou was buried at Bi'—Bi is in the middle of Du southeast of Hao.

sentences.zh: 秦滅周。

translations.literal: Qin extinguished Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Qin extinguished Zhou.

sentences.zh: 漢興九十有餘載，天子將封泰山，東巡狩至河南，求周苗裔，封其後嘉三十里地，號曰周子南君，比列侯，以奉其先祭祀。

translations.literal: The Han rose for ninety remaining years. The Son of Heaven would seal Mount Tai, and on his eastern inspection reached Henan. He sought Zhou descendants and enfeoffed their descendant Jia with thirty li of land, titling him Zhou Zi Nan Jun, equal to marquises, to serve their ancestors' sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: Ninety years after the Han rose, the emperor prepared to seal Mount Tai. On his eastern inspection tour he reached Henan and sought Zhou descendants. He enfeoffed their descendant Jia with thirty li of land, titled him Lord Zhou Zi Nan, equal in rank to marquises, to maintain their ancestral sacrifices.

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: Scholars all say Zhou attacked Zhou and resided in Luoyi, but comprehensively this is actually not so. King Wu planned it. King Cheng had the Duke of Shao divine the residence and placed the nine tripods there. But Zhou again made its capital Feng and Hao. Until the Quanrong defeated King You, Zhou then moved east to Luoyi. What is called 'the Duke of Zhou was buried at Bi'—Bi is in the middle of Du southeast of Hao. Qin extinguished Zhou. The Han rose for ninety remaining years. The Son of Heaven would seal Mount Tai, and on his eastern inspection reached Henan. He sought Zhou descendants and enfeoffed their descendant Jia with thirty li of land, titling him Zhou Zi Nan Jun, equal to marquises, to serve their ancestors' sacrifices.
